Historically New Balance only makes certain shoe models with their extra wide sizing.  The retro/fashionable models haven't usually been included in that bucket.  So when I saw these new 515's on my BIL's also wide feet and saw them being offered with this many colorways, on Amazon, for less than $100, it seemed too good to be true.I know I'm writing this like I'm about to bring up a big "but" with these shoes...  But I'm actually not.  They're actually extremely well made, breathable in the summer heat and surprisingly comfortable, even with just an EVA midsole and thin hard rubber outsole.  I'm also one of those weird goth kids from the 90's who proved it wasn't just a phase, so the minimalist blacked-out colorway also gave me a bit of the fizz.  The wider 4E fit and footprint is also identical to what I'm used to with my other New Balance faves (the 410v5 dark Trail Runners) but the materials feel even more substantial and quality.  Though I will admit that the sole response of the 515's is less springy and athletic-feeling than those kicks.That said, I've been wearing these shoes a LOT this summer and they haven't disappointed yet.  The leather has held up and stayed clean with no fraying at the seams or obvious signs of wear inside or out.  The midsole has well broken into the shape of my foot and toes, providing a decent amount of support and grip without looking agressively athletic.  Which seems to leave the 515's striding a happy line between looks and functionality that have made them my go-to running around town shoes going forward.If you have wide feet, you could do a lot worse.

After YEARS of wearing all sorts of shoes, and ALWAYS ending up with the outer sides of the shoes basically folded over the souls (so it looks like I'm walking on 2 broken feet), I had an epiphany of sorts. Surprise, surprise, they fit perfectly, my feet hurt way less, and I don't look like Quasimodo Frankenstein after having broken them in. No blown out sides and I might just try the "extra wide" option next buy. Thanks for offering "Wide" options and sizing options higher than 12, and at an affordable price New Balance and Amazon!

Thought that might be worth mentioning.I’ve had these since February and wear them 2-3 times a week…just walking, no running or training in these shoes. No unusual wear, and they seem to be holding up well. I like them so much  I’m going to get more in the other colors.

I bought a 10 Wide and it was not Wide at all. It's narrow on the sides and it's a slip on.  I was disappointed in that since I like the look on the shoe.  It felt good, but not the best if you're taking it out for a walk.  My main issue was the WIDE part and it snug on the sides.
Very comfortable

Its been few days only and the mesh near my thumb already torn and no the shoe is not tight. Could be a counterfeit product. My first shoe which got torn in few days. Others lasted years ad never torn from the front side. I am already out of return period. Poor shoe quality

Comfortable, lightweight, Sudo-excellent running shoe. The ease in which to put them on is 11/10. New Balance has always been a reputable brand and I’ve owned many quality shoes from them. This one is not it. It has zero longevity, and they missed the mark. Within 2-3 months expect it to wear out quick, and need replacement. A clear symbolism of Corporate Greed.

title: New Balance Men's 608 V5 Casual Comfort Cross Trainer
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable, well-made, and appreciate their long-lasting durability, noting they wear well for several years. They provide good arch support, particularly with inserts, and customers consider them excellent value for money. The size receives mixed feedback - while some say they are true to size and width, others find them too small.

Review.review: I am thoroughly amazed and grateful these are just what I needed. My last pair of NB were walking shoes and was last bought 5 or 6 years ago. I do tons of walking but don't drag my feet so the soles don't wear fast and I don't let them get wet, but it was time to get a new pair. These new ones are perfect in every way, absolute comfort, roominess, but snug enough fit with a good amount of comfort padding inside, and they have the exact size dimensions of the last size 15's I had from 5 to 6 years ago, maybe a slight tad wider for even better comfort. I love that they don't pronate (tilt to one side from overly spongy soles) and are even more stable for the ankle than the last ones. They also don't have excessive heel height which is a huge problem for me in this trend of making heels too high since i have ankle issues and had to have surgery on my feet at age 4, so I was told my my orthopedic doctor my feet could not handle excess sloping, i.e., higher heels. In this regard, it reminds me of barefoot shoes with a flatter more even profile, but still with good arch support and still perfect shock absorbing comfort (not excessive since I can't handle excess arches). Glad I came across the perfect fit shoe for me, though there is one thing I hope will last and that is four of the shoelace eyelets in the middle were done differently for stylistic reasons: they are put through some type of fabric loop instead of the leather that the other holes are made to go through. If those loops have stitching that fails at some point then one would have to resort to drilling a hole into the leather where it normally would go through because they had to do this "cool" looking style feature. Who knows, maybe it will last okay. The price is great too, and hope they don't read this and raise it!
The fit is perfect. The size is exactly what it says it is they’re comfortable well-made and perfect for work shoes awesome value. Very good support good quality shoe.

These shoes were recommended to me by a podiatrist friend.  He said they were the best bargain out there for a quality tennis shoe that was actually good for your feet.  I can't agree more.  These have become my go to tennis shoe.  I walk about 15 miles a week on a wooded trail and these have held up over a year.  I have ordered several extra pairs for wearing around the house or with shorts in the summer.  They have all performed great and they are so comfortable.They have been called "Dad" shoes...well I am a Dad so no problem here.

It’s not the greatest show but i’m a sucker for an old man show. Comfortable and they fit my feet pretty well. Not to bad if you drive manual and want a shoe you can do that in too. They don’t look to bad in my opinion ether, solid buy for the price i got it at.

This is not the shoe for shoe afficianados.  Although the style is very basic, it is very comfortable and stable while exercising.  This an ideal "dad shoe" for those looking for a solid daily wear shoe.

I bought this pair (12W) on August 23, 2024 and they have been great to wear on my daily walks. I have walked nearly 2 million steps since then in these shoes and they have great durability. I rotate them with another pair that I bought on Oct. 27, 2024, which has helped reduce the wear and tear. I removed the insoles and replaced them with PowerStep ProTech Control Orthotic Insoles and my feet feel great. The weight feels great on my feet and I don't have any foot fatigue after walking 10,000-20,000 steps in them. The 12W are now too wide for my feet but I still highly recommend this shoe. They are easy to clean and still look good on the outside. On the inside, I've worn the heel area out.I purchased the White/Team Royal version in size 12. I loved these as they fit better as I've been losing weight. The downside, the inside cushioning around the heel and ankle is gone. Worn out. I guess roughly 2,000,000 steps is a bit too much for this pair. Nonetheless, I do recommend these 608s.

Using these as outside work shoes since I walk over 7000 steps a day 6 days a week. The fit is perfect and they are true to size. The weight is about that of a casual hiking shoe; obviously not as light as a runner but not as heavy as my old work shoes. They feel both comfortable and tough at the same time. I’m hoping this will be the perfect combination for out door work where I don’t need a steel toe or necessarily strong water resistance.

title: New Balance Women's Fresh Foam X Hierro V1 Mid-Cut Trail Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with excellent ankle and arch support, and appreciate their appearance. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some say they accommodate wide feet well, others report they run very narrow. The cushioning and durability also get mixed reviews, with some finding them cushiony and durable while others describe them as super stiff and falling apart. While some customers consider them an excellent value, others feel they're not worth the price.

Review.review: I’m a recently retired, semi pro athlete, and I’m very picky about my footwear. I have a straight lasted, narrow foot; very neutral gait; normal arch and no structural or biomechanics abnormalities other than boney ankles. I bought these NB Hierro trail shoes in the low cut version and they turned out to be my favorite trail shoes ever! And they have great durability - after a year and a half of regular use, they’re still going strong (I alternate several pairs of shoes at a time to extend their mileage), but I’m soon ready to retire them to be yardwork shoes. So I wanted to try these with a slightly higher ankle to keep the dirt & debris out better. I was a bit nervous because my ankles are so boney, so high tops often dig in. But these don’t! 👏These are truly waterproof and have a gusseted tongue. They’re very comfortable, responsive and cushioned - every bit as responsive and cushioned as the low cut version. They’re light weight and very grippy, but you can still feel the road/trail for agility. And I really love the colors! It’s a very cold gray, almost blueish grey. The lavender with dark pink accent colors are beautiful. They aren’t too dark to wear in the summer, and they’re attractive without being too bold so they don’t clash with most outfits. These aren’t nearly as hot as my winter hiking boots that are actual hiking boots and not just high top trail shoes. It’s so nice to have both!There’s only two negatives, which the low cut ones don’t have. The toe shield on these is just leather, not hardened for extra protection like the low cut version. And you do have to be careful about how you lace these because the tongue is just barely wide enough, and something can dig in if you don’t get it just right. I rethreaded one hole on the left shoe from under to over, and it’s much better.I still wear Nike Vomero’s on the road, but these are my favorites for the trails! 🏃🏻‍♀️🥰

Update:Took these out on a hike at my local state park after a particularly wet week. There were lots of puddles, mud, and lots of places to slip.Tested water resistance when I sank into a muddy puddle. My foot got wet, but dried quickly. The traction was good when we had to cross large puddles on wobbly fallen branches.My feet stayed cool throughout the whole hike! I was impressed, even when it was pretty hot and humid out.Overall, these shoes are everything I needed them to be; cool, comfortable, cute, and supportive of my ankles and feet.————Original:I’ve been on quite the hunt for a shoe that offered good ankle support, that’s breathable for the summer, and something at least semi-cute. In the world of hiking, cute is not in the manufacturer’s vocabulary… at least nothing that is reasonably affordable. I’m pleased that these check all those boxes.I ordered these in a half size larger and in wide since I read several reviews about these being tight all over. The half size and width make these very comfortable and allow me to add thick socks for wetter and colder seasons! So plus!Bought these for an upcoming camping trip where there will be light hiking, but being pregnant, I need breathable shoes for the humid Texas heat. Haven’t had a chance to test them out yet, but will update me them after I get a chance to put them to the test.It’s worth noting that the rim of the ankles are stiff and does need to be broken in. Even with tall socks, they are rubbing.
Very comfortable and lightweight.True to size.
I loved these new balance hiking/running boots. They're super comfortable and they're cute and stylish. They worked perfect for hiking around Puerto Rico for a vacation this summer.
Great fit, comfortable,  and very supportive.  I'm very impressed.

I like the style of the shoe. True to size but the toe area is VERY narrow even in the wide option. Also, if you have high arches then where the tongue is sown it is a little bit uncomfortable. I’d never buy this shoe at full price. Wait until it’s on sale.

O. M. G. Where do I begin……First off, the shoes came in a generic (non New Balance) box which means they’ve previously been returned.Not a good sign.Tried them on and they were super uncomfortable around the ankles, very stiff and felt like I was being jabbed. Tied them somewhat loosely to see if that helped, it did not.  Maybe they need to be broken in?? With this in mind I figured I would give them a fair shot and test them out. Put them on with boot socks and got on the treadmill.NOPE. Less than 5 minutes and I couldn’t stand it. Felt like I was doing the Frankenstein/Herman Munster walk. Super stiff all around, not just at the ankle.Normally a huge New Balance fan so I am extremely disappointed. Definitely going to return them.

Really cute shoes and lightweight. Shoe came in NB box, however the box was not in best shape. Both shoes had visible scuffs at the toe area, 2 loose threads and hairs in one of the shoes. The soles looks new but there are visible signs it has been worn before. I wanted to love these but I will have to return them same day I recieved them unfortunately.

title: New Balance Men's Rush V4 Low Lacrosse Shoe

Review.review: Great shoes as advertised and at a good price. The wide size is actually wide.
I got the 10-wide shoes and, as others have said, they feel more like regular width shoes. Aside from that, these shoes are fantastic for running, sprinting, jumping, and cutting on grass.

After only a few months the heel on his cleat completely came off during practice. I tried to reach out to Zappos and Amazon on the issue and quality but was met with dead ends. Very disappointing. I have never had an issue with a cleat in this manner with only a few months of use.
Great for wide feet
These are not wide and won't go on at all.  The inner elastic attached to the shoe tongue also takes width away.

I really like the sole of this shoe. When my high schooler is running across the field he gets noticed for the neon color. They have held up all season and no complaints in comfort. Really happy with this purchase. Cleats are shown in real life after much practice in the lacrosse season. Definitely a good buy!
These shoes are great for my 13 year old lacrosse player.
Junky material and the side collapses when you’re standing.

title: New Balance Mens Fresh Foam X 1440 V1
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-made, and lightweight, with lots of cushioning that keeps feet feeling good. They appreciate the look and consider them well worth the price. The fit and size receive mixed feedback - while some find them a great fit and wide enough, others say they run a bit small and are narrower than usual.

Review.review: These so far are pretty good shoes. I got them in wide but I probably could've gotten them in regular. But they're not extensively wide. I'm a bigger fella 😅 about 275 lbs and these are very comfortable for long periods of time. As far as durability and longevity......... we'll see! I've been looking for something to replace Nike🤷🏻. They look sharp too which is what drew me to them in the first place. At this time I'd get another pair.
I’m on my 2nd pair already. Super comfortable and affordable
My husband loves these. Great arch support and fit. Very light. And great value. A home run for him

These shoes fit perfectly, are very comfortable, and are highly durable. However, I would steer away from the white ones if you’re planning to wear them outside often. I’ve had them for a few months and have had to deep clean them twice because of how much dirt they trap.

These are really good looking shoes. They look even better in person. I'm not the type to deduct a star for fit. Trust me, but a whole size bigger. They'll fit perfect. Another thing, the price is really good for the quality of shoe. Go to any store in person and try to find a comparable match... Impossible. If you're like me and have wide feet, make sure you get wide! Great shoe 5 stars.

So far so good ! Just got them 5 mins ago and they are very comfortable.  I have long skinny flat feet so they fit good but a little more room on top of foot but it's not uncomfortable. Every shoe I wear i put some happy feet insoles in and with these it doesn't feel like it needs it but i still will put them in for my work . I'm on my feet all day every day on asphalt and every kind of terrain imaginable doing auto.glass work so i go through shoes fast . Hopfully the bottoms last . Ill make an update after a few months
I have received so many compliments on these shoes. Very clean and stylish. (Sea Salt & Cork) color scheme is very original. Great product.

I never buy white shoes but I loved the look of these. They are very comfortable and the price was great. Very thin material and super breathable. Nice to walk in and have good arch support (I have high arches). Cleaning them though, not amazing. They aren’t the easiest to clean and it’s pretty hard to get stains out. But that’s what you get buying white shoes. I would definitely buy these again.

title: New Balance Womens Fresh Foam X Hierro V9
Customer_say: Customers find these trail running shoes extremely comfortable, rugged for hiking, and durable through repeated use. They receive positive feedback for their support, cushioning, and style, with one customer noting they feel like walking on a supportive cloud. Customers disagree on the sizing, with some finding them wide while others say they run small.

Review.review: I’ve bought the New Balance Women’s Fresh Foam X Hierro multiple times, and I absolutely love them! As I’ve gotten older, I’ve realized just how crucial a great shoe is for comfort and support, and these deliver in every way. The Fresh Foam X cushioning feels like running on clouds, providing a soft yet stable ride that’s perfect for my daily walks and occasional trail hikes. The Vibram Megagrip outsole offers fantastic traction, even on uneven or slippery surfaces, which gives me confidence on various terrains. I also appreciate the breathable mesh upper and the snug, supportive fit—though I’d recommend trying the wide option if you prefer extra toe room. The shoes are durable, stylish, and versatile enough for both trails and casual outings. They’ve held up well through repeated use, and I keep coming back to them for their unbeatable comfort and reliability. Highly recommend these to anyone who values quality footwear, especially as comfort becomes more important with age!

Why did you pick this product vs others?:I tried on several pairs of trail runners, and these were by far the most comfortable (I would have bought them from the store where they fitted me, but they didn't have the black shoe in stock, so Amazon to the rescue.) I myself need a thick and cushioned sole, so I can see how some people would find these too thick, but for me they are perfect. I wore them on one hike so far, without breaking them in, and they already feel more comfortable than my other hiking shoes that I've been breaking in for months. I feel like I can walk forever in these, which will be helpful on my Mont Blanc Trail hike I'm doing in 2 weeks. Additionally, they are stylish and sleek, and I've received many compliments on their appearance. I'm so glad I found these shoes!Fit:8.5 (true to size)Shoe quality:ExcellentColor:BlackStyle:Women's Trail RunnersComfort:Very comfortable, the best I've ever found

These shoes are very well built but run a little small. I reordered shoe in extra wide. I received this original pair as size 10 wide and it says it is but also says it’s B width. They are very comfy for bottoms of my arthritic feet. Worth the price if I can ever get the width correct .

Cannot speak enough about how comfortable these sneakers are. I have bad knees and need support cushion and rise in my heel to keep my leg steady. I came across these sneakers because I am a New Balance avid user but these have now replaced my 1080 version 14 running sneaker. They are more comfortable. The color ways are so stylish rugged for hiking and have great suspension. Just bought my second pair in the green color way I have the pink also.

these wear like heaven on my wide feet.  my shoe size is typically 9w but purchased 10w in this style.  i hiked all over southern utah in them and it was like walking on clouds.  i have a difficult time finding comfortable shoes and was absolutely thrilled with this pair!  they’re also really cute and don’t make my feet look big!
I have loved new balance shoes and these trail ones are perfect.  Great support and bottom cushion.  Lightweight and perfect for the trails! Plus this color is a great fit for the outdoors!
They ran small. I forgot new balance generally runs small. The cushioning feels good but they are tight around my toes. I might return them.
Novice trail runner here! Tried Saunconys’ initially and ended up with a horrible blister. These are SO comfortable and I still feel like I have control of my step. HIGHLY recommend.

title: New Balance Women's Fresh Foam X 840f V1 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-made, and good-looking, with good arch support that keeps feet supported all day. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some say the size is perfect, others find them too snug width-wise. The cushioning and durability also get mixed reviews, with some saying they're cushiony and holding up well, while others report the soles don't last. Value for money opinions are divided, with some finding them worth the price while others say they're pricey for the amount of time they last.

Review.review: Love these!! Cute color and great fit, goodArch support, very comfortable

I have trouble with my feet and these feel great when I step in them. Lots of space, soft cushioning--don't need my insoles in them even!  No having to "break them in"  Good shoes, get them quick, I'm sure they'll quit selling them soon because that's what they always do with the things i love!!
I have CP and an ankle fusion. This shoe has always provided the best comfortable feel and support I need for my brace. Thank you!

Buyer beware. You get what you pay for. These New Balance 840 v1 are nothing like the ones I have. Mine are over a year old and were wearing down. I got them from a local athletic shoe store. They told me there was a new model coming out and they were sold out of the ones I have. So, I went to Amazon. They had the size and style I wanted on sale with a $20 coupon. So, I jumped on it! Wore them around the house for about half an hour. They had no cushion on the bottom. The sole of my foot started hurting. No support for the side either. I put on one of my old, worn down shoes and the new one on the other foot. Even being worn down, the old shoe had much more cushion and support. Will be returning.

Great shoe, just not wide enough, for a “wide” shoe, it was more narrow than you’d expect at the toes. That’s where I need the room. Otherwise, comfortable. I am 250lbs at 5’5 and the cousin in this shoe is great.

I work 10-12 hr shifts as a restaurant manager. These along with some inserts have done wonders for my ongoing plantar fasciitis. I also have a weak ankle from multiple injuries. The support I get is better than any other shoe I’ve tried (there have been many.) I don’t get any foot fatigue, the shoe is lightweight and an amazing fit. The toe box is perfect for my wider feet. I will definitely re order. A great quality, holding up well a couple months in.

I have purchased new balance shoes in the past. They hold up well and are very comfortable, but in this model they run narrower. I have a wide foot and ordered the wide size but it was still too narrow for me. Usually new balance wide is wide enough, but not these ones. I gave them to my daughter and she really likes them.

Size 7.5 Extra Wide: perfect fit. The arch is good. The construction is good. I appreciate the extra-thick sole. Definitely will buy again. I've been wearing them almost daily since the day they arrived! The arch could be higher, but I have an under-insole arch support I inserted, so no issue there.

title: New Balance Men's Made in USA 990v6 Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes to be well-made with excellent workmanship and appreciate their built-like-a-tank comfort. The shoes offer good support, with one customer noting the top leather provides perfect stabilization, and customers like their appearance. While some customers say the shoes are true to size, others report they run large, and durability opinions are mixed with some finding them long-lasting while others report them coming apart after one month. Value for money opinions are also mixed, with some finding them worth the price while others consider them pricey.

Review.review: I had these shoes for  just ten years inured before I decided they are the best running shoes I have ever had by FAR.  Here are some observations.  The quality of the materials is excellent, perhaps other than the shoe laces that are just standard.  The fit, I wear an 11.5 wide was very nice.  I would say they may run slightly large, and by that I mean length, not width.  At any rate they are an excellent fit.  However the premium part of these shoes for me is the density of the sole.  Often shoes are described as walking on clouds but to me that means overly soft, these shoes have a firmness and give combination that is extremely comfortable for me.  I’m shocked at how good they feel.  One small note just to be fair, the insoles in these are suprizingly minimal.  I’ll probably replace them with something else.  Also the drop, that’s the difference in the height of the heel and the forefoot feels like 0 which I like a lot,  some running shoes have a huge drop and feel like you are walking downhill.  I like these much better.  Hope this helps.  Oh one more thing, they are expensive but I’m sure I’ll get enough wear out of their quality to make up for the cost.

The shoes look good. The navy color is a good shade of dark blue.  The shoes were comfortable on feet and for walking out of the box. I do get a half size larger in comfort shoes and add a gel pad sole to the existing soles.I have done well with durability in 990’s in the past but only time will tell with each new pairI use a different pair of speciality shoes for running
Nicely made. The fit is great! And the comfort is so much better than cheap shoes!

Great fit for my wide foot.  I had to return a couple other brands with wide sizes as I wasn’t willing to hope they might stretch out a bit.  The 990s in wide fit perfectly out of the box.  They were the most expensive of the lot but I’m am pleased with the quality and fit. Im a 9E and the 990s run true to size.
Has lasted for 3 years of every day use and counting. I would buy again.

I really like my New Balance 990v6 shoes. They’re super comfy and feel great when I walk. Not too soft but just right. The style is cool and not too bulky like some older shoes. I wear them all the time, whether I’m out running errands or just chilling. Plus, I like that they’re made in the USA. Definitely worth buying!

I quite honestly have square feet and was looking for a shoe that would compensate an extra-extra-extra wide foot and boy do these shoes do it. They run a bit big when you get to such wide shoes but it also has that extra space for comfort of your foot. All the rumors about these shoes about the value and quality and durability of the shoe are all true. I stand on tile for my work all day and my feet feel comfortable enough and supported throughout the entire day. I won’t be worrying about other brands and styles of shoes now that I found a pair that can take care of my wide Fred Flintstone feet!

Was excited to see American made shoes being sold on Amazon. Had been buying the China made low cost shoes and have just been very disappointed in the shoe construction quality. Yes, I paid more for the USA made shoes yet my feet thank me as I am walking with better foot support. Thank you Amazon for offering an American 🇺🇸 made shoe.

title: New Balance Men's FuelCell Supercomp Elite V4 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes excellent, with one noting they're fantastic for long-distance running. They are extremely lightweight and provide good cushioning, with one customer highlighting the perfect balance of squish and pop. Customers disagree on the comfort level.

Review.review: Great shoe, super comfy. Extremely light and great on my long runs.

These shoes are absolute BANGERS! Easily my favorite plated long run shoe. Comfort for days. The cushion to energy return ratio is perfect for paces under 6:30/mi. I ran a half marathon in them back in March and I felt totally supported and protected the entire time while also having enough speed to get a major PR. These are the shoes I've chosen to run my Marathon later this year and I feel totally confident in saying they are a fantastic option for middle of the pack runnersaiming for a 3:30 finish.

I’m newer to running (as an adult). I have too many of the current best shoes. This is one of my top two favorites and my one if I had to keep only one for races. It’s plush and protective,  bouncy and propulsive, and stable all togetherIt’s not as lively and springy as some others (like asics MEP) or as super plush and protective as some (NB1080V13), but it’s a great combo for a somewhat aggressive but still stable and protective shoe for a race or uptempo longish should run
Good
Very comfortable and improved my run, though at first it rubbed against my heel a bit and caused a sore for a little bit.
A really fun shoe to run in. My mid foot is pretty wide, so it wasn't a great fit for me but it's a great shoe.

This had to have been one of the worst experiences with an elite shoe I have ever had. The upper is not comfortable, and the heel digs into the Achilles, rubbing and tearing the skin until the shoe fills with blood. I had to take a heat gun to peel back the heel so it would re-form and curl backwards and not dig into me just to be able to use them. They run about a half size too small as well.On the good side, the cushion and plate create an amazing combo of plush and firm, a perfect balance of squish and pop. Nice and lightweight overall. Definitely a race day and speed training shoe, but not a recovery or mixed purpose one. Not reliable on dirt.Not impressed with the shoe for the price. I’m in the minority, but that’s my honest review.
Awesome

title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X Cruz V3 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, particularly noting the socks with rubber soles, and appreciate their lightweight design and good fit, especially for wide feet. The shoes receive positive feedback for their appearance and cushioning, with one customer highlighting the padded ankle areas. While some customers report good arch support, others mention lack of support at the heel, and durability is a concern as they fall apart within two months of use.

Review.review: Very comfortable.  Spongy feeling.  Look great.  Lightweight.  Nice.  I have more narrow feet and these are a good fit for me.

Out of the box, these fit better than I was expecting. I did go a full size up, opting with 13 EE rather than my normal 12 EE, and this was the right choice. I wear 12EE in the classic New Balance styles (574? Something like that). But these are smaller in the foot opening as well as narrower than that style/cut of shoe. So 13 EE fits perfectly, I can slide my foot in and out without untying, and the shoe isn't gonna fall off.They are very light and comfortable, especially after loosening the laces.I don't think these would hold up to major abuse or running, but as a casual sneaker for around town, I think they'll do just fine. I also don't think you should be jumping in puddles in these shoes either, else you'll be left with some very wet feet😂😂😂
Great comfort, lightest running shoes I’ve ever had, New Balance I will be buying from you now.🙌
Purchased these for my son in July 2025. He wore them for 6 weeks before he got a hole in the front. This has never happened before. The quality and structure is poorly done.

These shoes are super comfortable right out of the box and incredibly lightweight, which makes them great for everyday wear or casual walks. The style is clean and modern, and the walking ability is solid—your feet won’t feel tired even after a long day.However, there’s very little foot or ankle support, so I wouldn’t recommend them for running or high-impact use if you need strong arch support or stability. That said, the shoe quality still feels great overall, and they’ve held up well so far. For the comfort and design, they’re definitely a good value for the money.If you’re looking for something easy to slip on for errands, walks, or travel days—these are a solid pick.
Love Love Love. These shoes are so comfortable, the quality is great. Since I don't have an arch, these shoes provide the arch support needed. I wish they came in other colors.
For perfect.  True to size.  Most comfortable shoe ever.  Bought another pair in black

So far so good. I like the fit and overall feel. Never was a fan of the sock style before, but these have changed my mind. Had them for 2.5 weeks and put em through the wringer; walking, running, HIIT training, and heavy lifting…they’re holding strong. Will definitely get another pair.

title: New Balance Men's 520 V8 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and well-made, with plenty of room for feet and a classic dad style. They are lightweight and good value for money, and customers consider them excellent for running and walking. While some customers find them sturdy and lasting, others report issues with the interior coming apart and the soles showing signs of wear.

Review.review: A Fantastic Everyday Trainer and Great Value!I've been extremely happy with the New Balance Men's 520 V8 Running Shoe! This has become my go-to shoe, not just for running but for all-day wear, and it delivers exactly what you need at a great price point.Here’s what makes this shoe a winner:• Excellent Comfort for Daily Use: The EVA midsole cushioning hits a sweet spot, providing a soft and comfortable ride without feeling mushy. Whether I'm on a short run, walking the dog, or just on my feet all day, they feel supportive and light.• Lightweight and Breathable: The engineered mesh upper is fantastic. It keeps my feet cool and comfortable, which is essential, especially on warmer days or during an intense workout. The shoe feels light on my foot, not bulky at all.• Great Versatility and Value: For the price, the durability and quality are top-notch. It’s a great, all-around shoe perfect for beginners, gym work, and casual daily running. It holds up well and still looks sharp.If you’re looking for a dependable, comfortable, and stylish shoe that offers fantastic performance without breaking the bank, the New Balance 520 V8 is an absolute must-buy! Highly recommended for anyone needing a solid everyday athletic shoe.
Very nice and comfortable. Would buy again.

This is my first pair of New Balance running shoes. I've been running for over 15 years and have mainly stuck with Asics and Brooks as my primary trainers. Obviously the 520's are a budget pair of running shoes and are not going to be as nice or as durable as a more expensive flagship pair, but I've purchased many $40-60 Asics and these are fairly comparable. The 520 v8's are very light shoes with a neutral fit and a smooth tread. They make excellent racing shoes, but aren't a great option for longer distances. These shoes feel very stiff to me, more so than any of my Asics within this price range ($54). But take that with a grain of salt as my other pair of shoes right now are the Hoka Mach 5's ($160) that are by far the most comfortable, cushy shoes I've ever had. These are a great light shoe for runs under 5-6 miles at a time. I've found they start to lose cushion and get pretty hard after that. I tried a half marathon in these and wished I would have brought a second pair for the second half. They started to feel hard around mile 6 and by mile 8-9 they'd lost all cushion.In terms of longevity, I don't see these shoes making it much past 250miles. But again as a budget pair, that stacks up to the competition. I've been able to average around 300 miles in my "cheaper" Asics. They now have 100 miles on them, and so far they've visibly held up well, but already have a permanent crease in the mid-sole. The tread is holding up great with slight wear on the toe. The mesh, laces, and even the interior are all holding up well with no wear holes in the heel. (Like every pair of Asics get) I do have some light staining on the mesh / outside of the shoe, but of course being such a light color that's going to happen with outdoor running in the winter. I actually prefer these shoes for outdoor running over the treadmill. They're light and feel great as a fast shoe, but they're just lacking cushion for long runs or treadmill running. I also second the review talking about long laces. These shoes have the longest laces I've ever had on a pair of shoes. I mean annoyingly long; but you could always replace them easily. So far I've enjoyed these shoes enough to own another pair of New Balance running shoes, but my next "budget" pair will be Asics again.
Excellent fit really great and excellent for running.i work out slot at a local gym
Grandson LOVES these……took them out of the box & has worn them daily

One of the first things my PT said to me when I started therapy for my back was "You got good shoes." I'll take that as a thumbs up. These may have laces but they go on easy, and they're quite comfortable for a relatively inexpensive pair of sneakers. They look good IMHO, and New Balance products always seem to be made well. I'm not a runner so I can't attest to the functionality of the tread pattern, which is a bunch of "bubbly" circles; however I find these very comfortable for exercise-level walking or for daily activities and casual work.

I have worn these shoes only during my daily walk which is about 3.25 miles.  These were delivered on August 27, 2025.  Looking at the calendar, I have only worn them a little over 3 weeks and the sole is already worn down/out.  I walk on black top and concrete but I would expect NB shoes to last more than 4 weeks.  If you are looking for a good walking shoe, these aren't the ones to buy.  They were advertised as a running shoe, so I expected they would be good for walking, that was my mistake.
Very light weight. Nit much arch support

title: New Balance Women's 410 V8 Trail Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one mentioning they can wear them all day without hurting. The shoes receive positive feedback for their quality, fit, and appearance, with customers noting they feel great on hard-to-fit feet and don't look clunky. Customers appreciate the arch support, with one mentioning it helps prevent leg and foot fatigue during long periods of standing. The size receives mixed reviews - while some find the toe box wide enough, others say they run too small. Durability is also mixed, with some saying they last a long time while others report issues with the upper eyelets ripping within two weeks.

Review.review: I feel like Cinderella every time my shoe arrives. It fits like a glove as if it was made just for my feet. They are comfortable, durable, pleasing to the eye, and affordable. I work in a medical setting and can be on my feet anywhere between 6 to 12 hours a day. I also use them for yardwork outside and long walks. I not only enjoy the support they give underneath my foot, but also the sides.I have arthritis in both knees and between regular chiropractic adjustments and these shoes, it keeps the flareups to a minimum. I’m also overweight and again they offer maximum support and comfort.Would highly recommend them.

I love these shoes but not able to get in a 10 1/2 womens as I had before. Like new balance so I ended up getting a mens 9 instead. They are great shoes will stick to this brand, they are wide enough, wear well and very comfortable. I believe they are American made.
Love these. Super comfortable and they look nice

The shoe itself is great! It looks good, fits nicely and is super comfy. It fits very true to size, so if you are in between sizes, definitely consider sizing up.Shipping took longer than expected (the full two week window) and the shoes did not arrive in their original packaging due to damage. This package change was made before it was packed by Amazon and sent out.Overall, I would buy these shoes again, but the shipping experience was not the best it could be.
They are beautiful but runs very small. Looks like a kids size. I ordered 8-1/2 and they look more like a 7.
Comfortable,  true to size.
Wear 8 and ordered 8 wide. Fit great buy very stiff. I usually love new balance but the sole is really hard. Disappointed

These are my favorite New Balance runners but hard to find. They have good arch support and fit great.  If I'm running on wet road they are slip resistant and have nice cushioning.  Definitely great value for the money. A few years back I order these on amazon but they were never delivered and I lost money. These were delivered the very next day after ordering!

title: New Balance Womens FuelCell Rebel V3Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable for running 2-4 miles and appreciate their high quality, with one customer noting they're great for indoor track use. The shoes are lightweight and provide good cushioning, with one customer mentioning they're suitable for long-distance runs. They receive positive feedback for their traction, with one customer highlighting their effectiveness on concrete paths, and customers report pain relief, particularly in knee pain. However, customers disagree on the fit, and durability is a concern as heels collapse after one month of use.

Review.review: I ordered these shoes on sale, and ordered them a half size up from my normal running shoe size (or .5-1 full size up from everyday shoes) and they fit perfect! These shoes are plenty roomy in the toebox, have a nice colorway, the laces are thin and stay tied, and the gusseted tongue is thin, comfortable and stays right where it should. The shoes are highly ventilated and breathable, not to mention extremely light, bouncy, and fast! I do have some gripes with the seller, though. I ordered from Fast Goods and when they got to me, there was only the inner box portion, no lid, and it was beat up pretty badly. I could definitely tell the shoes had been tried on/worn, and were certainly a return or a regret for somebody else. I loved them so much, though, and got them at such a great price, that I was willing to keep them despite all that. I just didn't find it very professional of the seller to sell them as "brand new" when they really weren't, so be aware of that. I couldn't find the rose and white colorway elsewhere or at such a good price, so I cut my slight losses on brand new shoes and kept them, because they are truly a comfortable and amazing shoe. I intend to get at least 300 miles out of them if possible!

I absolutely love these shoes! I've been trying a variety of Asics, Hoka, Altra, Brooks, and Rykas over the past year. Most I either tried on in the store or purchased and wore for a few minutes before returning. Others I thought worked until discovering after a few weeks that they weren't right. I have metatarsalgia and Morton's Neuroma in one foot and have tried the shoes recommended by foot specialists. I need wide shoes for both toe box room and metatarsal comfort not constricting the outer edge of my foot. However, all these shoes resulted in some ball of foot soreness. I do Jazzercise, which involves jogging in place, jumping, lunging, balancing on one foot, and plenty of other footwork. It's important that my weight be placed primarily in the heel and arch to minimize impact to my forefoot. Only the FuelCell Rebel V3s have resulted in zero soreness during and after a class. They are light and springy to boot. When I stand for a long period, I am aware that there is no pressure on the ball of my foot or toes (and why I don't feel pain or soreness). In fact, I had to wear a pair of fancy stage shoes last weekend that hurt my foot. Afterwards, I put on these NBs, and my foot felt better within minutes. I've worn them for the past three weeks and want to purchase another pair. I only intended to wear these shoes to workouts but find myself in them almost daily because my feet feel so dang good.

Love these! Every 4 or 5 years I manage to find a pair of New Balance shoes in a color/style I love that I can't find locally. They are comfortable for me (I like the increased width) and I've washed them a few times returning the brightness of the "pineapple" yellow and they still look and feel great. Thanks NB, keep up the good work!

These Sneakers fit great.  I would have rated them a 5 but the tongue was too short for me.  I have planter fasiitis, metatarsalgia and a hammer toe.  These accomodate all of these conditions with a "drop" that I need to be comfortable.  I love New Balance!

Love this shoe!I have recently gotten back into running after a 35 year hiatus. After logging about 75 miles in September, I signed up for a couple of 10ks and a half marathon. My wife did some research and these were the shoes she decided upon and they are amazing.Incredibly light weight, breathable, tongue stays put while running, great cushion over long distance. I am 51, and the cushion on these things is great for my knees.I have since bought two other pairs of shoes, Hoka Mach X and Adidas Duramo Speed and the New Balance are still my favorite shoe.I cannot recommend them enough

I purchased these on 7 Apr, it's June 5th.  Like a previous poster, I tend to be a heal striker and bought these specifically for their rated cushioning and design for marathon runners.  I can't run anymore but I speed walk and put in between 4 to 10 miles 5 days a week.  I expected these shows to last at least 3 to 6 months.  Sadly after only a month and a half of use the right heel has completely blown out and is flat.  The sole is also pulling away from the body of the shoe so the shoes are garbage now.  To say I'm disappointed is an understatement.  I can't return them to Amazon now but Im hoping New Balance honors thier six month outer sole warranty.Sadly I can't recommend these.  I've used New Balance shoes for over 20 years and have never had an experience like this

Very lightweight running shoe with a spongey sole that I’m using as my work shoes in a hospital. I’m on my feet and walking around a lot indoors so I need a shoe that’s light, is breathable, and has some bounce. They are very quiet to walk around on hospital flooring. They’re not constantly squeaking.These wouldn’t be good as outdoor work shoes. These are great shoes if your feet get hot easily. They’re very breathable so they dry out quickly and completely after taking them off after a shift.I have a different pair of new balance shoes for running but I feel like I could do a marathon in these ones.I usually buy size 12 for converse all-stars, or Vans slip on shoes, but this style of shoe I needed a 12.5.I’ve been wearing New Balance for almost 20 years and I trust them for my work shoes and running shoes.

I was struggling with muscular issues, trying to run with my old, inflexible legs.  So I searched for some very "cushy" runners that would reduce the strike when running on pavement. NB always fit me well, so I chose these. They worked well, as I have been able to comfortably run 2-4 miles at a time.  Can't say how long they will last with such a soft sole, but I suppose that's a tradeoff to live with. I only have a hundred miles on them so far...

title: New Balance Women's Dynasoft Tektrel V1 Suede Trail Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes incredibly comfortable, cute, and lightweight, with one customer noting they're perfect for both running and long walks. Moreover, the shoes receive positive feedback for their quality, with one customer describing them as great hiking shoes. However, customers disagree on the sizing, with some finding them true to size while others say they run small. Additionally, the fit and foot support receive mixed reviews.

Review.review: I'm thrilled with these New Balance Dynasoft Tektrel V1. From the first wear, they feel super comfortable thanks to the Dynasoft technology, which offers a soft, cushioned ride, perfect for both running and long walks. The lilac and white design is beautiful and modern, and goes great with athletic or casual wear.The traction sole is ideal for uneven terrain, and the suede finish gives them a sophisticated touch that isn't found in all athletic shoes. Plus, they feel lightweight, breathable, and very well made.I would definitely buy them again! If you're looking for comfort without sacrificing style, these shoes are an excellent choice.
Love it! They are so comfy and I can wear it all day daily or go hiking. They are slightly bigger and heavier than my other snacker but super cute and nice quality.
Comfortable and cute! No break in period and great trail shoes for easy to moderate hikes. The purple is the perfect pop of color but also neutral enough to wear outside of hiking

I decided to wear my New Balance sneakers on a recent trip, and so far they've been incredibly comfortable! The fit is great for walking long distances, and I absolutely love the white and purple color combo — stylish and fresh. I’m not sure if they are waterproof but I’m very happy with this purchase!For reference, I am  8.5 shoes size.  These are 8.5 and fit perfectly.
I just wore these for the first time today on a 6 mile hike that included scrambling up some rocks. They were so comfortable! No break-in time. Zero complaints! Great quality.  True to size.

I purchased these shoes and really enjoyed the way they fit.I noticed right away that they seemed somewhat slippery.Decided to dismiss it and wore them to work.I had a terrible fall.They are worse than ice skates.I am not sure what material is used on the base.But by the grace of god, I didn't break my back.I have to return them.They should improve the good fit of that shoe with a vibrant sole
Light weight and fits and very beautiful designSoft and comfortable

Purchased these for my niece for a recent vacation to a National Park. She said they are very comfortable and they are quite cute as well. Excellent purchase! She reported the cushioning in these is spectacular!

title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X 840V1 Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes exceptionally comfortable, well-built, and great for walking, with one customer noting the laces stretch for increased comfort. The shoes offer good support and cushioning, with one customer highlighting the excellent heel cushioning, and customers find them visually appealing. However, the fit receives mixed feedback, with some finding them perfect for wide feet while others say they run smaller than expected. Moreover, durability is a concern as several customers report the shoes falling apart after 35 days of use.

Review.review: A very comfortable and form fitting sneakers 👟 It is light weight and gives the feeling of walking on air. Another quality pair from New Balance.
I love my new shoes. Well built and very comfortable.

These are the best for wide feet. The shape of the shoe is most like my foot compared to other NB models. I should have bought 2 pairs . These are so good when you have to do a lot of walking. I will say the fit will depend on the shape of your foot. If your foot is narrow or long, this shoe is not for you. My husband, for example, wears a NB 1080. I could never wear that model. The shape of the shoe is way different. I buy men's shoes because they are wider than women's. MAKE THESE IN MORE COLORS 💖

Great shoes! But it's annoying that for a wide shoe, they use short shoe laces. There is not enough room to tie a knot unless I go down an eyelet. WHY? This is such an unnecessary oversight. Irritating--I will have to buy new laces. FYI the laces they give you are 48". I figure a 54" lace will work better.

Like you are stepping on a thick sponge.Really good shock absorption.I have a none on bone knee issue so impacts and daily shock from walking makes my knee sore and swollen.I wanted to give this a try to absorb some impact, do far very pleased.Have not worn any other show since they were delivered.If you are on your feet a lot or impact make your feet tired or achy,  I woukd suggest trying g these. They're a little bulky compared to my regular running shoes, but the cushion is night and day. I'll live with the bulk and I have been happily. Extremely light and soft cushioned mid sole.

I was disappointed to learn that New Balance was discontinuing 840 V5 Running Shoe.  It has been the best shoe that I have ever owned.  I went online to find its replacement and it was recommended to try this shoe.  It is not as stable as the 840 V5 Running Shoe.  The fit is narrower even on the wide version which I bought.  The size seems to run 1/2 size smaller as I found the arch of this shoe pressing against my heel leaving me feeling like I want to slide my heel rearward in the shoe.  The foam in the shoe is squishy and leaves footing feeling unbalanced and unstable.I will be looking for new brand of shoes as New Balance seems more concerned with introducing new features to sell shoes instead of providing a product that is good for customer.
Feel greatThe laces even stretch to increase comfort

Picked these up to try and find a rocker shoe with enough width (4E) and volume for my carbon fiber inserts and prescription orthotics. These fit the bill, being able to accommodate both and affording a decent amount of lateral stability compared to others. Most importantly, I can get the carbon plates and orthotics into these and still get a decent heel lock without having to ratchet down the laces. I other words, the depth in the heel is great as well s the amount of cushion in the heel stay. I wish more shoes had a similar build to afford such a great fit in the heel when custom orthotics and such are in the mix.That said, the toe box could be a bit wider up front,  like a more natural foot shape (and ideally a straighter last on the outside of the mid foot. The New Balance Kaiha Road feels better in the lateral mid foot area, and is cushy, but lacks the lateral stability that this shoe provides). The heel could be more stable laterally, but it's better than a host of others I have tried and checks all the major boxes for my needs. e.g., The Hoka Bondi 8 is more stable laterally, but lacks the heel lock with the carbon plate and orthotics in the mix.

title: New Balance Men's 680v3 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-designed, and appreciate their quality and value for money. The slides receive positive feedback for their soft cushioning while running. The fit and durability receive mixed reviews - while some customers say they're the correct size and hold up well, others find them too narrow for size D(M) and report durability issues.

Review.review: I workout constantly and go through 4 to 5 pairs of athletic shoes every year.  With all the physical demands placed on my footwear, I've come to rely upon a few select brands.  New Balance is one of those brands.  Consistently reliable fit, always comfortable footbed, and made of durable and eye-catching materials.  This 680v3 is no exception.  The cushioning and construction support the foot well despite the workout load.  The toe box is sufficiently roomy.  Cushioning under the heel pocket and the metatarsal is substantial, yet it retains good motion control (lateral) for varied activities.  Removable footbed allows for orthodicts or foot beds with more cushioning.  But I have to say, this sneaker was comfortable right out of the box.  I use this pair for intense elliptical training and have enjoyed their support, construction, and good looks for 2 months now.  Great shoe!  Highly recommend!

If you're like me and have humongous feet, you know how hard it is to find any kind of footwear. You generally find something that's comfortable and available, and stick with that brand and size. For me, it's been New Balance 14 extra wide for the last 20 years or so (yes, I'm a dad, and old). This has been fine for sneakers, and I even got a pair of NB hikers that have been working pretty great for me.My family and I love the beach, and every time we find ourselves shopping at the beach, I instinctively check the flip flop rack for something in a 14. To this day, I've never seen anything on those racks above a 13. So I went to Amazon, found a nice looking pair of flip flops, and the largest size they had was a 14. Figuring I could return if it didn't fit, I pulled the trigger. When I got them, I couldn't even get my toes past the straps. There is no way they were bigger than a 12!So I continued shopping the Amazon, and lo and behold, these New Balance slides showed up in my search results. Thinking they've never steered me wrong in the past (and I could return them again if they didn't fit), I decided to buy these in 14 X-wide.Like a lot of people said, they definitely need some breaking in. I just wore them around the house with socks on (never with socks in public though) for a few days, and they feel amazing now. I generally don't leave reviews this quickly, because I like to see how they hold up after a few months, but so far, so good. They feel relatively sturdy, and given how quickly I destroy shoes (I'm a big, active guy), I'll be happy to get two summers out of these, and with what I've seen so far, I don't think they'll disappoint.

I love the thicker bottom for added comfort but not too thick. I used these as home slippers. It's tighter than Puma. For Puma it's bigger so I usually go 2 size down for slides but for New Balance their sizes are smaller and more narrow so I went 1 size down. it fits but a little tight. Over time I'm sure it'll loosen up with break in.

While I think this shoe is fine; I the removable insert that comes with the shoe is very thin and rather hard/stiff. As such, I thought these shoes were rather uncomfortable. I should note that I weigh 195; and as such, prefer a shoe with a little more cushion. (Not that it needs to be like a pillow; but I find thinner/harder insoles uncomfortable).I was going to return these shoes; but I purchased some insoles (around $20) that provide much more cushion. Perhaps a guy who weighs less would find these shoes comfortable as is, with a thinner/hard insole; but I did not.Now that I have the softer insoles instead of the hard/thin insole that came with this shoe; I find this shoe very comfortable.I also like the square/boxy toe box; which gives my toes plenty of room, rather than a more tapered shoe that narrows at the toes.These shoes cost much less than many of the running shoes available. (Which is nice). However, be aware that if you are not a light-weight guy; you may need to spend a little more money to buy some softer insoles to put in these shoes.
Great fit, and comfortable materials.
Good slides very comfortable
I'm not sure if it's in the description but it should be posted that the width is too narrow feels like women sandals but it's seemed comfortable

Honestly, these are some pretty nice sandals. My old pair had worn out so I was looking for something a little more stylish, and I’m glad to say these hit the mark. The navy blue color is sharp, and the logo adds a nice contrast while still being understated. They fit true to size and are very comfortable.The ridges under the toes took a little bit of getting used to, but after wearing them for a while I’ve found they actually help keep the sandal in place. I mostly wear these around the house, and they provide a surprising amount of arch support — which is rare for sandals — so they’re comfortable for extended wear. The suede-like material wipes clean easily if you spill something on them, and the stitching feels very solid. They are also fairly lightweight, but not to the level of a shower flip flop.Overall, they seem durable and well-made, a great value for a comfortable and stylish sandal from a quality brand.

title: New Balance Womens FuelCell 990 V6Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, with the FuelCell technology keeping feet comfortable, and appreciate their quality and timeless style. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some find them roomy for orthotics, others say they're much narrower than expected. Customers disagree on the support, with some finding them great for arthritic feet while others report poor arch support. The size and durability also get mixed reviews, with some saying they last for 2 years while others report issues with fraying edges and stained laces. While some consider them well worth the price, others find them expensive.

Review.review: I got these several days ago and am in the process of breaking them in.  I've been buying this model of New Balance for many years since they fit me and work well for everyday walking and casual living.  There is good arch support, they're very comfortable If I could find another brand that worked so well, I wouldn't hesitate to try them.  So far this is the brand that works.  They are pricey though, but they work for me and last years!  I got them a 1/2 size larger than my previous ones because I feel I need the extra room.
Comfortable and good fit for my narrow foot!
Recommended by my podiatrist, these are good quality, durable, and comfortable.  I wear them every day.

These shoes are really comfortable if you are walking and on your feet throughout the day. I have wide feet for a woman and I went a half size down from my true size because this shoe runs a little long. Other than that, going a half size down fits perfectly. They are not as firm and heavy as a shoe like the Nike Air Max, but they still provide a fair amount of stability and support. I definitely recommend this shoe for active people and I personally plan on buying another pair when this one gets old.

I love New Balance 990 shoes and have bought them for years.  For some reason, this year's women's 990v6 has shoe laces that are too small to tie.  I went to my local New Balance shoe store, they said that everyone was unhappy with this and that I should call NB customer service.  After half an hour on hold, New Balance Customer Service told me that they do not solve shoelace problems, and that the problem is all mine.  The shoes come with too-small laces in 2 different colors (how special is that!).  It is costing me an additional $15 to order replacement shoelaces on Amazon, while taking my best guess at the right size to order.  I asked NB Customer Service to at least document the fact that their product has a problem, and the agent seemed overwhelmed at the effort that this would require.  With a $199 price tag, something here should really be handled a lot better.  Any chance that someone up there will read this?Footnote:  I bought the extra shoe laces, and now I really hate these shoes.  There is a huge amount of shoelace showing (is this supposed to be decorative?), and I prefer a shoe which is less shoelace, and more shoe material.  New Balance seems to have considered this, by providing 2 pairs of shoe laces - one white and one navy.  Theoretically, the navy laces would be less visible.  Unfortunately, the shoe has a white piping around the lacing area, so the navy laces just look dumb.  Use the white laces, which will never stay white, and they cover 1/3 of the shoe's front.
I wish they shipped with navy and white laces as I prefer navy more.  No arch support - I had to add my arch support insoles but overall really comfy and good looking shoe.

I have a very narrow shoe size, and it's difficult to find shoes that fit. I don't wear any sneakers other than New Balance because they fit perfectly.  I expected to pay about the same price as I would if I purchased them at the retail store, but they were a little less expensive on Amazon.
It’s súper confortable and I love it sooo much I will get this repeatedly every time it’s worn out

title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam Garoe V1 Trail Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with feet not hurting and being perfectly wide enough for their feet. They receive positive feedback for their quality, style, and suitability for walking and running, with one customer noting they're ideal for long walks or extended wear. The cushioning and durability receive mixed reviews - while customers appreciate the cushioned feel, some mention the soles wear down quickly, and while some find them extra wide, others say they run small.

Review.review: These have been a great pair of shoes for about two years now and I wear them quite frequently.  They have been durable and grip the ground well.  I don't use them for trail running but have used them for light hiking on well worn trails that are not aggressive enough for a boot.  Mostly these are just for everyday use in my case.  The color hides diret well and after spraying them with some cleaner and throwing them in the wash with detergent I was surprised at how well they looked when they came out.  The size is true to fit and I plan on buying another pair while they are still available.

The shoes are very comfortable and work in rough surface terrain well, because they do not let you slip. However, they can get wet vey quickly if the terrain you are walking on has water at a high level, because they are not that thick in the lower part of the instep. After a year, the shoes present no damage at all.
They were awesome the fit and comfort I have wanted  having 4 E feet it's hard to find sneakers that fit
Awesome shoe great comfort. I just wish I would’ve gotten them on a wide other than that. I love them.

These are the best pair of sport shoes I've ever had. Not exaggeration! I had a total knee replacement 5 years ago and have always been aware of knee discomfort. Well, when i put these on, I experienced stability at my ankles and the shoe did not tilt the ankle inward nor outward. I feel that I take solid /secure steps. I've done a good amount of walking as in Disney, and felt good all day. Tired from all the activity, but no concern with my knee. I recommend this style and brand.
Fieles a la talla comodos y resistentes ideales para entrenar
New balance never disappoints.Very light and comfortable.
Good shoes for active workouts 💪

title: New Balance Men's FuelCell Supercomp Elite V4 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes have a great fit. However, the heel grip receives mixed feedback, with several customers noting that the back digs into their ankle. The shoes receive mixed opinions about their bounce, lightness, and style.

Review.review: Great shoes for longer, fast runs. Assistance from plate really helps as fatigue kicks in. Digs into back of ankles a bit but getting better as they break in.

I previously had the V3's, and while those had a breaking-in period and some hotspots, these V4's are nearly a perfect fit. I did some sprints with them today and it felt like I was flying. I'll be going on a long run with them this weekend, but I expect that they will hold up. Buying running shoes is usually a challenge for me since I need to shop for Wides, but these V4's are a slam dunk!

The tongue of the shoe, yes, pretty garbage. Going to blister near the Achilles as well, based on the design of the shoe. Pros: propels you forward based on the design—light, but not the lightest carbon plate shoe, but still very light. Good support for heel runners; the color and design scheme look flashy, but not too much. Overall, a good starter super shoe compared to Nike's quality.
Received used item

They fit nice and snug, but the back digs into my ankle. It belt like an actual knife cutting into my ankle when I was just walking. Shame because the carbon plates definitely make you stay on your feet.

Comfortable, springy, great fit!  I love running in these shoes so much I want them to be my daily runner. The price makes it hard to justify as a daily runner though. So mostly I'll use these the final few weeks up to and including races and then back to my regular shoes for regular training.

The SC Elite v4 is one of the best carbon-plated racers I’ve used. It combines a propulsive ride with surprising softness, making it perfect for long races like the marathon where comfort is as important as speed.The updated FuelCell foam and Energy Arc plate offer a smooth, rolling transition that doesn’t feel overly aggressive or rigid. The shoe feels fast but forgiving, which is exactly what I want over 42K.The fit is performance-oriented but comfortable. The upper hugs the foot well, is breathable, and doesn’t cause any hot spots even after 30+ km.One small note: the outsole grip is decent but not amazing on wet roads — just something to keep in mind. That said, for race day, this shoe is a serious contender and offers great durability for a super shoe.____Las SC Elite v4 son de lo mejor que he probado en zapatillas con placa de carbono. Tienen una pisada muy propulsiva pero con una suavidad sorprendente, lo cual las hace ideales para carreras largas como la maratón, donde también importa la comodidad.La espuma FuelCell mejorada y la placa Energy Arc ofrecen una transición fluida y con buen impulso, sin ser demasiado rígida ni agresiva. Se sienten rápidas, pero sin castigar las piernas, justo lo que busco para los 42K.El ajuste es ceñido, pero muy cómodo. El upper se adapta al pie, transpira bien, y no genera puntos de fricción, incluso después de más de 30 km.Como punto menor, el agarre de la suela en pavimento mojado no es el mejor, así que vale la pena tenerlo en cuenta. Pero para el día de carrera, son una opción excelente y además duran más que otras superzapatillas del mercado.

To be honest, I returned these BUT its because I need 4E shoes. When I put them on to try, it did have a lot of bounce. These are for sure race day shoes, I can't see them lasting for more than 150-200 miles. I have herniated discs and need a good pair of shoes, these are great but not made to be every day shoes. Depends on your mileage I suppose, I'd likely tear through these in a month if I were to use them as daily running shoes. Super comfy, style is nice, sizing is correct. Wish they made a 4E version

title: New Balance Men's 1540v3 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes to be a great American-made product with good support, particularly for weak ankles, and appreciate their comfort, with one customer noting they can run for 2 miles comfortably. The shoes offer plenty of space for toes and are suitable for wide feet, though some find the toe box too small. Durability is a concern as the toe webbing comes apart, and while some consider them worth the price, others feel the quality doesn't match the cost. The cushioning receives mixed feedback, with some finding it feels great while others say it's not too cushiony.

Review.review: Why did you pick this product vs others?:Excellent quality shoe from a company New Balance that has an excellent reputation. This replaced an earlier version of this model and it fit perfectly as expected. It's very stylish and I live the grey color with blue accents. The rollbar feature helps with my supination issue as it helps to prevent my foot from rolling out. It also helps my plantar fasciitis. This shoe is also very comfortable and provides excellent support.
They fit and are extremely comfortable
Husband has very wide feet and New Balance does a great service offering such wide sports shoes. They hold up real well and he finds them very comfortable.
First time I have ever ordered shoes online. They fit perfect and exactly what I ordered in a very short time.

I had major foot reconstructive surgery, and my physician specifically told me to purchase these shoes.  I've owned plenty of New Balances before. These are bulkier than I expected, but don't look like an orthotic shoe (which is a win!).  They're comfortable, and the stiff sole is just what I need. I was able to put in my custom arch insoles.  The stiff sole and arch support reduce stress on my ankle, which is the goal for me.  I took off one star because a hole formed in the toe area after 1 month of light wear.  I suspect this was a defect, and not normal for this shoe.  Either way, Amazon customer service was awesome and let me return even a little outside of the return window.  I bought it again, and hopefully I'll have better luck.

I’ve own these shoes for over 2 years. Running shoes? These things weigh about a pound a piece. Would never wear these to run in. These are stability shoes, if you need stability while running, to the point that a 1 pound shoe will help, then by all means by them.I use them to work in. My ankles tend to roll, and have never had a more durable shoe!! These shoes are tanks! It’s like having the armor around your feet. I’ve worked in them for 2 years at a job 10 hours a day, 4 x’s a week and they look like they’re new. They’re hard as all get out, look like something Herman Munster would use, but no ankle movement and you are stable like you’ve never been. Don’t get them to run. Get them if you’re not that stable walking around.

I have been wearing the 1540 and its predecessors for nearly 20 years. I have gone through at least 30 pairs. Before this one there was the 1122 and the 1121, both in various v versions. Once before, a new version was bad. The product got bad reviews and sales tanked. They then quickly fixed the problems and came out with a v2 version. This shoe series, along with Brooks "The Beast", are the 2 best shoes for people who may have planter fasciitis, use orthotics, are overweight and/or over pronate. It is built on the New Balance S2 last which produces a straight lasted shoe with extra room in the toe box. The extra room in the toe box is a big deal for people with diabetes, neuropathy, bunions, etc.I wear these shoes every day. I keep 3 pairs in service, wearing each pair every 3 days. This allows the foam in the soles to re-expand between wearings and keeps the foam soft and cushiony much longer. I put a new pair of shoes into service every 18 months, replacing the oldest pair with new ones.I could see immediately that the 1540v3 is a whole new design from the v2. I put on the shoes and wore them around the house all evening. I immediately noticed that the shoes do not have that wonderful, soft cushiony feel that I am accustomed too with a new pair of this series of shoes. The soles are much harder and have less cushioning. The main reason I replace these shoes is when they no longer have enough cushion in them. I can tell, because my feet will to hurt badly at the end of the day. So to start out with new shoes that already have hard soles is a non-starter for me.The second thing I noticed with the v3 is that I am feeling hard pressure points through the arch support area and also along the outside edges of the shoes. I think this is caused by the combination of my orthotic inserts and the harder soles of the shoes. The pressure points were bad enough to make my feet sore after wearing them around the house for a few hours. This is also a non-starter for me.The shoes also have completely re-designed outer soles and the shoes have a more solid feel when you plant your foot and walk forward. The shoes resist rolling to the inside or outside more than the v2s. I like this more solid feel, but time will tell whether this increases or decreases foot comfort.The length of this shoe is exactly the same as the v2 model. The toe box of the v3 has a little more room in it and feels less tight on the toes. The front of the v3 toe box now points inward a little unlike the v2 model which pointed straight ahead. This crowds the outside of the toes a little and could be a problem for people who have bunions. Bunions shift the toes towards the outside of the shoes and crowd the toes against the outside of the shoes. I do have small bunions, but with the wider toe box on the v3 model, I don't think it would be a problem for me. I think this change was made to make the shoes look more stylish, but could decrease comfort for some wearers.The shoes have more padding along the sides and rear of the ankles which makes them more comfortable in those areas.  I really like the new styling and colors of the gray and blue shoes. The uppers seem to be made of stronger, more durable materials that would resist staining.  These are all nice improvements. The main thing I have disliked about the previous models is that they seem to wear out to quickly for a shoe in this price range. The soles lose their cushioning and the outer soles seem to be made of a soft rubber that wears away too quickly, especially in the heels. Time will tell whether the v3's will last any longer.Because of the lack of cushioning in the soles, these shoes no longer work for me. I am going to try out a pair of the Brooks Addiction 14 which worked out pretty well for me when New Balance ruined the 1122 model some years ago. I  may also try out a New Balance 840v4 model. If others also find the soles too hard on the v3 model, we may be seeing a v4 coming out soon. In the mean time, I will be keeping my eye out for v2 shoes in my size and color.Update on July 2, 2021: I just saw an announcement that the 1540v4 shoes will be released in Oct. 2021. This, the V3 version, will start to show limited size availability and, shortly before the V4 is released, will be offered at big discounts. I hope the V4 goes back to a softer sole like the V2 version has. If so, I will likely start wearing them again. In other aspects, it is a very good shoe.

Based on the sizes shoe companies now market, I must have rare narrow feet. So most of the shoes I've bought for the past few years have been way too wide for me.  Finally found these New Balance shoes in narrow width!  First shoes in years that are comfortable and stable!  Beyond that, they're well-made and look pretty good.  The relatively low stack height and minimal drop also contribute to their stability. If you prefer the super cushy type where you have no feel for where the ground is, you should probably try something else. But if you want fit and stability, try these.a

title: New Balance Mens Fresh Foam X 1080 V13Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes extremely comfortable, with no pain or soreness on first wearing, and appreciate their build quality and cushioning, particularly noting the additional cushioning in the midsole area.
