The shoes are perfect for wide feet, and customers say they're great for both walking and running, with one customer comparing the experience to walking on air. While some customers report the shoes holding up well, others mention issues with them coming apart at the toe, and while some find them worth the price, others note they're not the cheapest option.

Review.review: I’m on my second pair of 1080 v13s. When I first started running in them I wasn’t sure I liked them. There’s an extreme level of cushion that I wasn’t used to. Over a few weeks of using them though, I fell in love. These are some of my favorite shoes I’ve run in. They’re a bit heavy for track workouts or interval sessions but for just about everything else, these shoes are great. I’ve really enjoyed them on longer efforts. In long runs they’ve kept my legs fresh. When I pick up the pace to marathon effort, or maybe even a touch faster, I really feel like I’m able to get some good energy return. But of course, slow, recovery, or just plain easy runs are the bread and butter of the 1080s.These are also a great option for casual wear - so much comfort.

Best shoes I have ever gotten. Super comfortable, this is THE FIT I have been looking for at 11 X-Wide. I love New Balance and they are getting a long-term customer from me now. My feet got busted after running a half-marathon this February on some old Ghost 12's. Those are probably decent shoes, but the width is probably what killed me. 1080 V13's have been my recover walker because I could not walk properly for a week or so. It is so decently plush, but not ridiculously so, and provide ample support for your feet to heal. I use this to my work where I have been walking a LOT every morning. I'd recommend to purchase on sale, but I think this is worth their price at regular price too.
Super comfortable! The best running shoe I have owned so far. Great looks and build quality with a wonderful insole as well. Super soft under foot and super lightweight.

If you need a wide toe box for whatever reason (e.g. arthritis, big feet), this is the shoe for you.  The trend in shoes seems to be huge soles with clunky heels that can actually be problematic when going down stairs.  These are much better designed and excellent for your daily or exercise requirements.  NB makes the best shoes and you will find the style and fit you need.

These are my go to for both comfort and everyday shoes. I have been wearing them for a year and they are on of the most cushioned shoes I own. They also look like a normal shoe and don't have the big lump in the back like other running shoes. I wear them for walking and standing and they are still cushioned. The tread is still holding up and there is not wearing down yet. They are pricey but you get what you pay for. I would suggest if you haven't tried one on before to give it is shot! These New Balance 1080 V13s are insanely comfortable. Do not settle for an 880 of some lower shoe when this is an option.
Color is a bit more mustard (not very appealing) than I’d like , but for comfort and functionality while running they’re awesome. These are 5 star shoes with a star deducted for the hideous color.

These have been my favorite shoes for months now.  Best athletic shoes I have ever owned.  I love the wife base, which held with stability when I am working out and walking.  Excellent fit.  Very comfortable.  The shape is excellent for smooth walking.

Too narrow(better than others), so I bought it's brother More v5 size 14 next. This fresh foam type of shoe is more comfortable than any other shoe I've tried. My feet still feel bad due to lack of padding, after a hundred miles at once. But no other shoe has more padding. But the More v5 version of this, is the probably the best I can get for my long runs. For me, even More v5 is too narrow, at their widest. Maybe, my feet must be wide? Mom always had me where narrow shoes, so they wouldn't become wide. It was uncomfortable but evidently not effective. (btw, Arma socks are the best for blisters, Features socks are a distant second) Blessings

Review.review: I like the design and the colors on this black, light gray, and white sneaker.  But even more than that I like the comfort this sneaker provides. I have chronic ankle ache issues on one foot and so I really have problems finding comfortable shoes but New Balance Fresh Foam 880 sneakers always provide great comfort and support.  They give me a bounce to my step and  I would recommend these sneakers highly.  *However be careful when sizing them.  They are women's shoes so go by women's sizes when buying them.

The color of these sneakers is so pretty - it’s like a periwinkle and really can work with any color leggings.  They are incredibly comfortable and supportive.  I run daily and these hold up.  The toe box isn’t too big but not too tight and it helps my gait so that I’m not pronating.  They are very light, as well.  Really great running shoe!  I would purchase again.

These are hands down my favorite shoes by new balance. I love the support they provide, and the mileage I get out of them. Perfect trainers for light to mid runs. Also good every-day shoes.  Thankfully they have my size - 6.5W and it's true. Would order again.
This is my second pair because I love them! The fit is perfect and they are oh so comfortable! I plan on getting a different color to match my outfits.
I have had this for a little over a month and run 5 miles a day and love this sneaker I am a 8.5 size and bought a 9 for when I run but should have bought a 9.5 great sneaker

Very nice shoes, fast delivery, but shoes are too small. I will update to let you know if I do recieve a refund and give seller more stars.(Update) the nice people that I returned the shoes to gave me a full refund, so I added a star🌟
Very comfortable for walking. Love the color. Sneaker is lightweight. I like New Balances.

great comfort. great fit. fair price.

Review.review: I power walk on a treadmill and also sprint. This is the most comfortable sneaker I have ever worn and its very well made and sturdy. Great shock absorbtion. I am a former Hoka Bondi 8 wearer but they stopped making it. This New Balance has more cushion then Hoka Bondi. I can only wear 4mm heel to toe and this shoe has it.
was told by new balence that thee toe box was large and it was very comfortable
10/10 the best go to sneaker for work, running, etc
Not ask soft everyone claim them to be my nb 1080 are better

These keep getting worse. V4 was the peak. As soft as the midsole is, they have gotten less comfortable, the toe box is more narrow, the shoe keeps getting uglier and uglier. I know that’s subjective and personal but I just want a black upper and a while midsole. They are heavy as well. Which kind of goes with this tier of shoe, but if the idea is to buy them for all day comfort, my experience is that the V4 gave me that. Oh and the laces are shorter. That seems kind of irrelevant until you have to crank them down the tie them they way you prefer.In the end many people like them. I feel like they are moving away from the optimal form they had. title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam Arishi V3 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, lightweight, and suitable for various activities including working out, hiking, and general walking. The shoes receive positive feedback for their fit, particularly for wider feet, and their appearance, with one customer noting their foot-shaped design. While some customers report good arch support, others mention insufficient support and cushioning. The sizing receives mixed reviews, with some customers appreciating the roomy toe box while others find them too narrow.

Review.review: I love these. They're my fav brand of sneakers. Fit perfectly and are comfortable from day one.

These shoes feel like slippers. Very lightweight and comfortable fit. I bought them with the intention of using them for long walks and they work perfect for that purpose. I have also ended up wearing them to work most days as they are just too comfortable to pass up when I'm grabbing shoes in the morning.**All that said, I do not use these shoes for jogging or hiking. I prefer a shoe with lots of stability when I jog and hike and these have very little of it. I have a fair amount of pronation in my steps and these are not able to account for that. And as far as hiking goes, these shoes not only have no support, but the sole has no traction whatsoever.I would recommend this shoe to anyone looking for a very comfortable walking shoe and/or casual everyday shoe. But I would not recommend these shoes for any use with a higher impact than just walking around.

I was looking for a wide-fit running show that was affordable, as I am just starting to run as part of my efforts to improve my health and activity. I wanted something to try as a test, typically I just run in whatever shoes I have, but I've found that my feet hurt and often form blisters.These met my price criteria and had great reviews at the price point, often taking the "budget" spot on top-lists on various sites. I'm not disappointed. My feet don't hurt and I haven't had anymore blisters despite increasing the distance in which I run vs. walking. That said, they aren't perfect for my wide feet in particular. I have found that they don't have enough in the arch department. This could be specific to my foot shape, but I've found that while it is wide enough to be comfortable, along the center it doesn't have  a wide enough base and my foot tends to rock inward as it lands. This leads to at least one of my feet becoming fatigued as that interior muscle along my arch tenses to make up for the lack of support.  If you have wide feet with little to no arch, this could be an issue for you as well. You'll want to stick to even terrain to combat this and pay attention to how your stride is landing, my neighborhood doesn't offer much perfectly flat road, unfortunately.That said, they are cheap, they are light, they keep my feet feeling fresh after a workout, instead of feeling sore all over. No blisters, no rubbing, no noticeable wear so far. A great holdover shoe for beginners until they can graduate to more expensive contenders in the wide-footed running space.

I had been trying for nearly a year to find a new tennis shoe for my workouts. I love New Balance so I kept trying different ones they offered but to no avail. I didn't like how bulky some of them felt. And it was quite an ordeal, because where I live there are like 3 options for stores to buy shoes. So I was mostly buying online, trying on at home, and then sending back when they didn't work out. Finally, it dawned on me that I should search for the style of New Balance that I already had. Sure enough, this one came up. I was skeptical after placing the order, thinking surely this will be another fail. But no, they fit great just like the previous ones I had of this style. I typically wear a 10, but since they're for exercising, I went up to an 11, because you always want that extra room for your toes. They're light weight, very comfortable and exactly what I wanted. Success!!

Finally a shoe that fits me. I love New Balance. NB designs and comforts are great. I tried another brand to switch out. It felt like I was walking on wood. NB is easy to put on and off. Bottom part is not very soft compared to my previous NB. But I don’t walk too much as So it’s ok. If you don’t walk for many miles, it’s great sneakers. I got size 81/2. I wear this size. It fits just right. I buy 81/2 in other brands too. So this size fits true. Great price on Amazon too.
Love these shoes, take them with me to the gym, man I'm still using them. Worth every penny.
Buenos tenis
They were cute. Not soft at all. Maybe is will comfortable with gel inserts.

title: New Balance Women's Fresh Foam X Hierro V1 Mid-Cut Trail Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with excellent ankle and arch support, and appreciate their appearance. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some say they accommodate wide feet well, others report they run very narrow. The cushioning and durability also get mixed reviews, with some finding them cushiony and durable while others describe them as super stiff and falling apart. While some customers consider them an excellent value, others feel they're not worth the price.

Review.review: I’m a recently retired, semi pro athlete, and I’m very picky about my footwear. I have a straight lasted, narrow foot; very neutral gait; normal arch and no structural or biomechanics abnormalities other than boney ankles. I bought these NB Hierro trail shoes in the low cut version and they turned out to be my favorite trail shoes ever! And they have great durability - after a year and a half of regular use, they’re still going strong (I alternate several pairs of shoes at a time to extend their mileage), but I’m soon ready to retire them to be yardwork shoes. So I wanted to try these with a slightly higher ankle to keep the dirt & debris out better. I was a bit nervous because my ankles are so boney, so high tops often dig in. But these don’t! 👏These are truly waterproof and have a gusseted tongue. They’re very comfortable, responsive and cushioned - every bit as responsive and cushioned as the low cut version. They’re light weight and very grippy, but you can still feel the road/trail for agility. And I really love the colors! It’s a very cold gray, almost blueish grey. The lavender with dark pink accent colors are beautiful. They aren’t too dark to wear in the summer, and they’re attractive without being too bold so they don’t clash with most outfits. These aren’t nearly as hot as my winter hiking boots that are actual hiking boots and not just high top trail shoes. It’s so nice to have both!There’s only two negatives, which the low cut ones don’t have. The toe shield on these is just leather, not hardened for extra protection like the low cut version. And you do have to be careful about how you lace these because the tongue is just barely wide enough, and something can dig in if you don’t get it just right. I rethreaded one hole on the left shoe from under to over, and it’s much better.I still wear Nike Vomero’s on the road, but these are my favorites for the trails! 🏃🏻‍♀️🥰

Update:Took these out on a hike at my local state park after a particularly wet week. There were lots of puddles, mud, and lots of places to slip.Tested water resistance when I sank into a muddy puddle. My foot got wet, but dried quickly. The traction was good when we had to cross large puddles on wobbly fallen branches.My feet stayed cool throughout the whole hike! I was impressed, even when it was pretty hot and humid out.Overall, these shoes are everything I needed them to be; cool, comfortable, cute, and supportive of my ankles and feet.————Original:I’ve been on quite the hunt for a shoe that offered good ankle support, that’s breathable for the summer, and something at least semi-cute. In the world of hiking, cute is not in the manufacturer’s vocabulary… at least nothing that is reasonably affordable. I’m pleased that these check all those boxes.I ordered these in a half size larger and in wide since I read several reviews about these being tight all over. The half size and width make these very comfortable and allow me to add thick socks for wetter and colder seasons! So plus!Bought these for an upcoming camping trip where there will be light hiking, but being pregnant, I need breathable shoes for the humid Texas heat. Haven’t had a chance to test them out yet, but will update me them after I get a chance to put them to the test.It’s worth noting that the rim of the ankles are stiff and does need to be broken in. Even with tall socks, they are rubbing.
Very comfortable and lightweight.True to size.
I loved these new balance hiking/running boots. They're super comfortable and they're cute and stylish. They worked perfect for hiking around Puerto Rico for a vacation this summer.
Great fit, comfortable,  and very supportive.  I'm very impressed.

I like the style of the shoe. True to size but the toe area is VERY narrow even in the wide option. Also, if you have high arches then where the tongue is sown it is a little bit uncomfortable. I’d never buy this shoe at full price. Wait until it’s on sale.

O. M. G. Where do I begin……First off, the shoes came in a generic (non New Balance) box which means they’ve previously been returned.Not a good sign.Tried them on and they were super uncomfortable around the ankles, very stiff and felt like I was being jabbed. Tied them somewhat loosely to see if that helped, it did not.  Maybe they need to be broken in?? With this in mind I figured I would give them a fair shot and test them out. Put them on with boot socks and got on the treadmill.NOPE. Less than 5 minutes and I couldn’t stand it. Felt like I was doing the Frankenstein/Herman Munster walk. Super stiff all around, not just at the ankle.Normally a huge New Balance fan so I am extremely disappointed. Definitely going to return them.

Really cute shoes and lightweight. Shoe came in NB box, however the box was not in best shape. Both shoes had visible scuffs at the toe area, 2 loose threads and hairs in one of the shoes. The soles looks new but there are visible signs it has been worn before. I wanted to love these but I will have to return them same day I recieved them unfortunately.

title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X More V4
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one describing them as walking on a comfortable firm cloud, and appreciate their cushioning, noting they feel like walking on pillows from toe to heel. The shoes receive positive feedback for their fit, particularly for wide feet, and are perfect for both walking and running. Regarding support and durability, opinions are mixed - while some find them supportive, others report reduced lateral stability, and while some say they hold up great, others mention the bottom sole falling apart.

Review.review: It’s like walking on a cloud! They are so soft and comfy, tons of support, i bought two to alternate for the rest of my life

First off, I'm a shoe nerd. I admit it. Growing up my Dad would buy us only 𝙏𝙃𝙀 cheapest shoes he could find. They were so bad that we'd wear them out in a couple of months and I should be honest, I am not hard on my shoes, either (my older brother was a different story). Didn't make a difference. My Dad would rather buy us a pair of new shoes for $20 every couple months rather than spend $35 on ONE pair that would last at least a year (if not more). As a result, when I finally got a job and could buy my own, I had quite a collection. A habit I continue to this day.With that in mind, within the last year I've purchased 2 other pairs of New Balance trail running shoes which were (at that time) the most comfortable pairs of shoes I had ever purchased. Since then I bought a pair of Brooks Ghost Max which replaced those as the most comfortable pair of shoes I had ever owned.The Fresh Foam X have now replaced (by a slim margin) my Brooks for sheer comfort. I don't really run, but I DO an awful lot of hiking and walking. So strict comfort is pretty important to me. These shoes are simply brilliant in how comfortable they are. The previously mentioned New Balance Trail runners were, for a lack of a better term, had almost too much cushion. I know, how can a shoe have TOO much cushion? Well, those do...at least for me. For instance, I would never wear them for weight training, especially doing the dead lift. The cushion is SO pronounced that I'd be worried they could pull me off balance a little too easily. But then again, they aren't designed for weight lifting, so just keep that in mind.The Foam X shoes are a perfect balance between great cushion and sheer comfort. It must be hard for companies to achieve that balance without going too far but Kudo's to NB for pulling it off. The soles aren't as durable as the trail runners perhaps, but oh man are they a joy to wear. Again, since I don't run I cannot speak to how stable they'd be at doing any long/short distance running but man am I happy with mine.Overall 𝙏𝙃𝙀 most comfortable shoes I own (and I own a LOT). I am VERY satisfied with my purchase.

I originally bought these to be used as my slow, long run shoes, but find that they are so easy to run in that I always end up running a tempo run in them.  They are so soft, yet responsive and my knees and back do not hurt after a 10k in them at race pace.The only problem I have with them is they are HOT.  On a hot summer day, your feet will sweat like crazy in them, so it is best to run when it's cool else you might end up with wet shoes haha.New Balance really hit it out of the park with these.  They are my favourite shoes next to Saucony Hurricanes (which were discontinued), and I feel that I may need to get more pairs in the future.Fit was true to size in length, but the wide (2E) is really wide and feels more like a 3E to myself and I am forced to use ankle lockdown to keep my feet from sloshing around during the first half of my run.

I really like these shoes, I got them for work, because I am on my feet all day. I am a fan of New Balance shoes (I have many), and the reviews have been quite favorable from a lot of shoe experts. I have narrow and flat feet and hoped that these shoes would keep me comfortable all day by fitting good and feeling good. There's a fairly wide toe box that gives my feet room to move around, but not too wide where I can lock in my feet comfortably. Stability is kind of an issue because the shoes are stacked high, but I'm just using them to walk at work. The arch support will hopefully keep my flat feet pain free throughout the day, time will tell. There's a lot of padding and weight with the shoes that are probably going to be a little warmer than most, and they're not very breathable. I can count on New Balance for their shoe quality and durability; they should last a long time. I was able to get these under 100 dollars in this color which is awesome! Navy blue is favorite color! You can't do any wrong getting these! V5 is out now, but I'm not sure about those...

They are very comfortable for my complaining feet. I have worked with them daily for over a year and they are still like new in quality and comfort. They certainly rattle a bit when walking but I don't mind, I'm not a ninja.

I have been struggling with a wound on the ball of my foot for almost 6 years. I have had special orthotics, worn a boot and seen several podiatrists who all wanted to do some sort of different surgery. I bought these shoes after seeing a you tube video about relieving pressure on your forefoot for runners. I thought maybe it would help me. It really has. My wound is the best it has been and seems to finally be closing.The shoes fit true to size. I got wide ones and they are very comfortable in the toe box.  They are extremely light weight. When the package arrived I wondered if it actually had shoe inside.There is a slight learning curve if you are not used to the way these shoes redistribute your weight. At first it feels like you’re falling backwards a bit. That subsides quickly. And finally, I think they look great though my family was quick to call them “Dad” shoes. Well I am a Dad, so maybe it’s not that bad. I certainly don’t think they look like the older stereotypical new balance that men would wear with tube socks and shorts. Overall I’m super happy and on the hunt for a pair of hikers with similar geometry.
Amazing cushioning! I love these for runs 7+ miles. Keep my feet and legs fresh
Great shoe. Beautiful.However, there was a smudge like a drop of glue fell on the side which is slightly visible. I have decided not to return it.

title: New Balance Mens Fresh Foam X Garoé V2
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-made, and supportive, with good cushioning and style. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some appreciate the nice wide width, others report sizing issues. The lace loops are problematic, with multiple customers reporting broken bottom loops. The fabric quality also gets mixed reviews, with one customer noting it feels like recycled plastic.

Review.review: These sneakers are amazing! They’re very comfortable, lightweight, and look great. Perfect for everyday wear or workouts. I love the design and how supportive they feel on my feet. Definitely recommend!
Good cushioning. Comfortable  Fit correctly.  Walked around Vegas for 5 days  without feet hurting. For the price its a good shoe.
Shoes are awesome! They look great! Super comfortable. True to fit

It took a little bit over two weeks for delivery. It came from across the country seems like. they drove it across the country. It took so long why not put it on a plane I’m just saying.. the shoe size 10 wide true size very comfortable wearing them. They always feel like I don’t have any feet no pain no aches . New balance used to be the old man shoe. I used to think that way too until I started wearing trail hiking and running shoes tons of colors. I didn’t  have a black pair so I tried these. I have the successor to these.  these are a little bit different but still very comfortable. Had them on for a couple of hours today felt awesome.We’ll see how it goes.
Best shoe I got
Nice
Not wide
Light weight and super comfortable. Husband needed new everyday wear and work shoes and he loves them. Great support and cool colors too.

title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X 840f V1 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these walking shoes comfortable, well-made, and worth the money, with good support and pain relief, particularly noting they help with sore ankles. The size and durability receive mixed feedback - while some find the width perfect, others say they're smaller than expected, and while some find them durable, others report the soles fall apart quickly.

Review.review: Due to a medical issue I need shoes that are very cushioned, durable, and wide. I’ve tried other shoes that are very cushy, but they weren’t durable and the cushiness wore out quickly. Less cushioned shoes that are durable aggravated my medical issue. Then I saw these and, despite not having a lot of reviews, and a kind of high price point, figured they were worth a shot.I’ve been walking around with these for the past few weeks and I’m impressed! These New Balance shoes check all the boxes: very cushioned, very durable, wide width is perfect, and they’re very stable to walk in.They’re very chunky but really lightweight too. The only thing to be wary of is that New Balance runs SMALL. I sized up 1/2 a size from my normal size, and these fit great.To me the higher price was worth it because these shoes solve my main issues and they’re well made. I plan on buying a back up pair too.Great cushy durable value for the money.
As a senior with balance issues; this shoe helps with that problem. They are comfortable and so far durable.
Soft, comfortable, this is my second pair!When my feet or legs hurt they are the only ones that I can wear!😍
Excelente producto
Very comfortable shoes . I’d buy again.

Time will tell naturally. First impression is wow !! Most cushioning and spring I've felt in a sneaker. You know the popular brand that looks like these. Well they'd be a little more firm then these. Great cushioning , toes and heel as well as great arch support. I recently had a big back surgery , as well as bone on bone in one knee and bad left hip arthritis. These have been great in helping the pain subside. Probably will grab another pair. Very happy with the purchase. Only gripe would be some more color variations.

These are the most cheaply made, expensive shoes I've ever purchased. Zero durability!! The poorly designed soles started coming apart on not one but two pairs that I owned, after wearing them for only a few weeks. I am NOT hard on shoes. Shoes, even considerably less expensive ones usually last me a long time. The first pair of the New Balance started coming apart shortly after I started wearing them on light terrain. Amazon replaced them. The second pair started coming apart after I wore them about 5 or 6 times. This was from daily, gentle use, not even long walks. The soles have a honeycomb design. This design is flawed as segments of the sole start coming loose & create "flaps" that make it impossible to walk in them. I continuously glued down the segment flaps with Shoe Goo to make them somewhat usable. $10 would be too much to pay for these!

The shoe is comfortable but the "Fresh Foam" insole is the worse part of the design. Gave me blisters on 4 of my toes, like sand paper. Purchased Dr. Scholls power bead insoles, changed the whole shoe in a good way. No more sore ankles, much easier to do 10,000 steps in one session. Replace the insoles, you won't be sorry.

title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam 680 V7 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and well-fitting, particularly noting they accommodate wide feet without being too tight across the foot. Customers praise the shoes for their quality, light weight, and good arch support, especially for those with narrow flat feet. The shoes receive positive feedback for their appearance and value for money. Customers disagree on the sizing accuracy.

Review.review: I love these shoes!

I have another pair that have finally worn out since 2017. Remember- these fit to size. if you wear a 10, don't buy a 9 wide. Buy the 10. Great arch support and comfortable. They breathe well. My feet never get hot or sweaty. These runners are comfy and can even give you good support on moderately difficult hiking trails without any problems.

Super comfortable great for long walks or runs.Just received 3rd pair of these shoes. Pair that came were previously worn you can see scuff marks on toes and marks on soles of shoes. I shouldn’t have to pay regular price of $89.95 for used pair. They also came in generic cardboard box not the New balance box like the other pairs.
Nice and comfortable shoe I ordered size US 9.5. I think it came a little short in size.

I've run for almost 3 years in the defunct NB Evare, my first Fresh Foam shoe which offered very good cushioning. The 680v7 is similarly priced replacement. The 680 doesn't feel quite as cushiony and the heel is lower but I find it good for my 4 mile runs. Some complain about the narrow toe box but I find the toe box roomy compared to my other NB shoes.One BIG quibble - sizing. I bought my first NB shoes 10 years ago, size 10.5 D. Over the years, NB sizing has become smaller and smaller to the point where I'm ordering size 13. I take maybe size 10 in regular shoes. Extremely annoying.Size 13 is slightly loose but 12 is too tight. But it works well for me since there's room for the PROFOOT Orthotic Insoles for Plantar Fasciitis which compensate for the cushioning and heel height and also add arch support. Running feels very comfortable with the inserts.
I absolutely love these sneakers. They are light and comfortable and the ex-wide is perfect for my wide feet. They also fit my orthotic inserts comfortably.

New Balance is my go-to for affordable, reasonable quality athletic shoes that fit wide feet.  Their shoes are true to size, fit my wide feet, and last a reasonable amount of time. Obviously you get what you pay for, and their premium shoes offer more, but the value shoes hit a sweet spot for me.This 680 is the same as always. I've been wearing it for six months and it's held up. When it falls apart I'll buy another.I have never been unhappy with a New Balance shoe.

This is a great running shoe to run with. Because they are so affordable, I bought two pairs in order to rotate them throughout the week, but I liked them so much that I purchased one additional pair to use for work. My weekly mileage is nothing crazy--about 25-30 miles per week, and after putting over 100 miles on them they are still comfortable. Once I feel that I need to replace the ones I have, I will purchase the same shoes, or at least another NB shoe. I hate spending over $100 on a pair of running shoes, so I love the fact that this brand makes great running shoes that are affordable. I no longer buy any other brand of running shoes. They do run a bit small, for me anyway, so I have to buy a half-size bigger than I normally do with previous brands.

title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X Hierro V7 Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one mentioning they felt good during a 20-mile hike. They receive positive feedback for their quality, appearance, and grip, with no slippage reported. The fit and size receive mixed reviews - while some find them great for wide feet, others note they run tight and the width sizes aren't accurate. Durability is also mixed, with some saying they last a long time while others report them falling apart. The cushioning receives mixed feedback, with some finding them soft to walk in while others say they're not overly cushioned.

Review.review: This is a great shoe!  Super comfortable daily shoes for me for the last few weeks, but there is a huge caveat: the toe boxes are low volume. The roof of the toe box is very close to the tops/knuckles of the toes. I tried my usual Saucony and NB  size, 10.5, in store and did not notice the claustrophobic toe box. I ordered 10.5 on Amazon and wore them in the house but never could feel comfortable and figured they would drive me nuts! I tried 10 wide (not extra wide) and that gave my digits more breathing room, solving my problem. I made a good choice going down a half size, as I believe 10.5 wide would have been too big.  The rest of the shoe does not seem to fit wide (admittedly I have not really worn wides before).Now that my toes can relax a bit I can appreciate the plush comfort of these babies. I like that the heel cups are not harsh or unforgiving, they are a little supple. I have been nursing both my Achilles tendons for a few weeks now—breaking in Brooks Cascadia 16s on one hike nearly broke me!!I never notice the extended fins in back; I thought they might “catch” going down carpeted stairs, but no issue.I am almost ready to get back in the mountains with these and really test them (and my heels) out. I will mos def buy more when I see a deal. Hierro V7 are my new favorites and I have tried numerous Adidas, Saucony, Merrill, North Face, and Scarpa trail runners and hikers the last few months. Robust, comfortable, and look rad.Edit:  I just did about an hour in the dry Boulder Flatirons at Chautauqua Park, and I love these shoes. The wides were barely big. I kept them fairly loose due to concerns with my Achilles and needing some extra give going uphill. Tightened them a bit just before descent, as usual, but didn’t wanna fiddle with them again. Can easily, comfortably lock them down a bit more next time.Comfortable on trail, very soft, you do feel big rock points and ground features underfoot, but I did not mind. These Hierros do not feel tall to me—great height/stack/drop that reminds me of my fave NB trail runners from 20 years ago. (I only wonder how they will hold up given how soft they are.)Edit: I now have three pairs of Hierros. Gotta say I would love some rock plate protection underneath as I have to be careful with foot placement on particularly pointy, sharp rocks (like 10% of the time on foothills trails). I occasionally trim down the hairy, wispy fibers that work their way out of the abrasion protection of the toe box. The shoes are all pretty easy to wipe down with a washcloth after a dusty hike.The Gore-Tex fit for me just like the regular V7.  I thought I’d need to go up a half size like I often do for Gtx, but they were too big. Went back to 10 wide and they fit very well. You have to look at all the pix in the Amazon ad to see which are the Gtx (navy/black, crazy bright green!, and black/orange). I got the black with orange bottoms and have to say the orange is strangely close to pink—not the “classic” orange and black I expected. Not noticeable enough for me to exchange, though. They also have skinnier laces than the non-Gtx. The thicker laces work perfectly, but the skinny ones are a little finicky and knot up on me sometimes.  GREAT shoes.

Awesome shoes. Great grip. Was able to wear it straight out of the box and didnt need to break them in at all. I bought these to use for playing cricket and will most likely use for any hiking trips. These fit true to size and provide great support for walking and running. Highly recommend.

Purchased these for walking a gravelly terrain along an old railroad right of way. These fit my feet perfectly! I normally wear an 11.5 wide and this pair is true to size. The thick outsole took the larger rocks like a champ and my feet felt wonderful after a 2 mile after dinner walk.I would recommend these to anyone who may suffer from feet, knee or hip pain. I know all bodies are different but these work for my older chassis!

I love this shoe. It was bought for elderly man easy hiking in mountains. Only short break-in time needed. The fit, feel and heel comfort are great. Overall sole cushioning is good without being mushy. But the best feature is the Vibram sole. It adds desirable overall stiffness (less toe lift), added width gives lateral support, and lessens feeling sharp objects beneath. The nicely lugged sole on smooth, interior surfaces feels secure, although produces some suction cup sounds at times. As other reviews have pointed out, the semi-hardened toe shields do produce unsightly “fiber hairs” over time.  I have trimmed them and they still come back. I do not know what impact this has on the shoe’s function or use expectancy.

I have flat feet and suffer from Plantar fasciitis, which causes debilitating pain in my feet for days if I'm overworking my feet or wearing improperly fitted footwear. It's gotten so bad in the past I couldn't get out of bed without support like crutches or a knee scooter. It's heartbreaking to me to say the least, as I really enjoy being active and outdoors, but am afraid of the smallest slip or pushing it too hard for the fear I will be out of commission for days, so these days I am very very stringent on what footwear I buy/wear. I bought these after a small slip caused a PF flareup on the disc golf course, which is very hilly and full of uneven ground and rocky terrain.From early on I could see that these were a perfect fit for me, the wide size actually accommodated my foot and didn't bulge out like Nikes or Adidas shoes of the same size. The cushion is just enough without being "marshmallow-y" to where I've rolled my ankles in other shoes. the grip and weight of the shoes are great to avoid slips when walking up/down hills and rocky terrain. I've walked to/from my local disc golf course and played multiple rounds of disc golf back to back (~10 miles and 5 hours on my feet) in one day with not even soreness in my feet! The night/day difference after buying these shoes still astounds me.These are my absolute go-to shoes anytime I'm doing some outside active activity, I've even started doing short hikes/trails with the confidence that I won't have pain the next day and can just focus on the most important thing, enjoying the outdoors. I've been wearing these so much I'm seriously considering buying another pair or two before I wear these out prematurely! Those with flat feet or PF, don't think twice and pick up these shoes!

title: New Balance Women's Fresh Foam X Hierro V8 Trail Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and well-cushioned, with good arch support and durability, particularly noting the long-lasting cushioning and tread. They appreciate the style and quality, with one customer highlighting the feminine-looking pink soles. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some find it true to size, others say it runs small. The grip aspect also gets mixed reviews, with one customer mentioning they keep them from slipping on wet cobblestones.

Review.review: Love these shoes!! Like walking on a cloud, fit perfectly.
Very comfortable,  feel like walking on clouds, I forget I have heel spurts, love the colors,my feet feel supported, fit perfect i have wide feet, good quality.

I buy two or three new pairs of tennis shoes every six months. I prefer to buy shoes that are last season or marked down.  I purchased the Hierro shoes at full price, and was not disappointed. I need a hip replacement, and I fall often. Every surface on this shoe sticks to the surface I am walking on. I fall less when wearing these shoes. The fit is as expected. I have a wide forefoot, so I buy shoes with a wide fit. New Balance is the only brand that works for my feet. The shoes are durable and stylish- I highly recommend them.

These are cute, comfortable and supportive. I've been trail hiking about 3-4 miles each morning and bought these to give me more cushion and ankle support on the trails. This Yellow/Mustard color is fun. Buy a half size up - I'm usually a size 10 in Nikes, but in the New Balance, I needed a 10.5.

I’m an ex semi-pro triathlete. I’ve had a few injuries and I’m not 29 any more, so I’m very picky about my shoes. I used to only run on roads for speed but do trails now that I’m retired from competing. This is my second pair of NB Hierro trail shoes. My first pair were v7 Gore-Tex, and they were the best trail shoes I ever had! They’re very comfortable, have enough cushioning &  protection, but I can still feel the ground which I like because they’re more agile. They’re light enough, and they look nice. And I love the toe protect! It has saved my toenails more than once. And both the cushioning and tread last incredibly long - longer than Nike and much longer than Brooks. I like these better than the Nike Pegasus trails because I felt my heels slip in the new Pegasus trails and because these have the toe protect and they last much longer, although I still prefer Nike Pegasus and Nike Vomero on the road.I like to have a second pair of both road and trail shoes to alternate each, and I only need one pair of each with Gore-Tex for when it’s wet because without GTX they’re more breathable and a tiny bit lighter. These v8 have a different tread than the v7 that is more grippy; otherwise they feel identical.The only thing I don’t like about these is that they’re wider than the last model, why do not to be a dealbreaker. I actually double check the box to make sure they didn’t send me the wrong width. I probably won’t buy them again because of this.These arrived in a super beat up New Balance box with torn paper. Fortunately, I don’t really care about that. They were sealed in a plastic bag and then in another box that was in perfect condition for shipping. The shoes themselves are fine, but I can tell they’ve been tried on because the laces were twisted. Again, I don’t really care because I got them on sale and they’re otherwise brand new with the tags still on, but I thought I’d mention it for people who might care.
Purchase on a great deal day. Comfortable while walking. Style and quality is wonderful. The fit and value for the money: unbeatable.
Very comfortable. Great fit, true to size.
Excellent Comfortable, soft and durable, it was what I expected and more.

title: New Balance Womens Fresh Foam X 860 V14
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and well-fitting, particularly noting their wide toe box and good arch support for flat feet. The shoes receive positive feedback for their cushioning, with customers describing the feel as amazing, and customers appreciate their nice appearance. While some customers report no foot pain, others experience blisters. The durability receives mixed reviews, with some saying they last long while others report issues.

Review.review: I’m obsessed with these shoes!! They are unbelievably comfortable and supportive, and I can wear them all day without my feet getting tired. The cushioning feels amazing, and the design is so sleek and stylish. Honestly, they’re perfect for everything—running, walking, or just everyday wear. Definitely my new go-to sneakers!

Comfortable and supportive.  Like the color. Laces could be a bit longer but not big issue.  Fits my usual size.  Helps to stabilize my arthritic foot when I am walking.  Might be too warm for summer but rest of seasons, is comfy.

So far, I have been very satisfied with the comfort and wearability of this shoe.  I was reluctant to buy a shoe with a fairly thick sole, but the shoes were recommended by physical therapists as being one of the best for people whose knees are sensitive to concrete floors.  The shoe is well-padded inside - the arch support is perfect, the heel cup keeps narrow heels in place.  The toebox is wide and gives your toes plenty of room to move in.  Also, important to me is the mesh covering over the toe box.  I had surgery on my right foot and can never find comfortable shoes.  These shoes fit the bill.  Best of all, walking on concrete and suffering the rebounding effect of sore knees is gone.  The inner sole feels ergonomically designed for the bottom of the feet, and there is deep cushioning with a bit of spring action.  This is a perfect shoe for me.  I bought a pair of white shoes but want to buy other colors, as well.

I’ve been wearing these for a while now, and they are my favorite shoes for walking and working out at the gym. Great stability for the ankles, nice cushion for the foot, plenty of room for the toes. Will buy this style again.

This stability shoe seemed quite comfortable in every respect. I wore it around the house, then purchased it. When I went for my daily 3 mile walk, I realized what wasn't apparent during the time in the house with it: the toe box, even in a wide, was rather snug. It was wide enough, but shallow. Over the extended time of the walk, my second toe became sore. I'm normally a size 7, purchased a 7 1/2. If I were doing it over again, I'd get it a full size bigger. I own a NB 1080 size 7 1/2, and the toe box is roomier, so it's this particular model.

It's harder for me to find shoes because I need them to support my overpronation, but I also where a 2A (narrow) width. There's not a lot of options, but this one is perfect. It's very comfortable, supportive and looks nice as well. Size is accurate. The bottom of the shoe actually has a good design and seems like it will last a while.

As far as the stability shoe and comfort, this is a wonderful sneaker and believe me I have tried many what I cannot understand is how the sizing is so off !I wear an eight and typically size up to an 8.5 in my running sneakers. I ordered a nine based on reviews saying that the sneaker was small. Had to return currently wearing a 9 1/2. ! I also have narrow feet and these are borderline too tight for me in the regular with, but the wide was too wide.

I wore these shoes for a 12 hour shift right out of the box. I took an extra pair of shoes to work with me just in case, but didn’t use them. I had wanted some white shoes for a while and when shopping for a white shoe many had other colors or weren’t really white. These are nice and white. I bought my regular size and they fit fine. I have worn New Balance shoes in 3 other styles and all of them fit and are comfortable so I felt pretty confident that these would too. I’m on my feet for almost all of that 12 hour shift .  My feet were tired but not at all painful. So these are good for work and I will wear them for walks and  other casual wear.

title: New Balance Womens 840 V5Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes great for wide feet, with a roomy toe box and true-to-size fit. They receive positive feedback for their comfort, with one customer noting they can walk for many hours without pain, and customers appreciate their support, particularly the great arch support. Customers like the look and color, and while some find the cushioning great, others say it's not well cushioned. The durability receives mixed reviews, with some saying they last a long time while others report mesh rips and seams separating around the toe.

Review.review: The 840 is the perfect shoe for me. I have a wide foot, a small bunion and I have had surgery for neuromas. A tight shoe will cause me discomfort and aggravate my feet. The 840 has a wide toe box, I have to buy an extra wide.  I wore my first pair of 840s for almost 2 years. I exercised or walked 5-6 days per week and never had any problems. A couple months ago I bought the 880 in an extra wide, thought they were wide enough, within ~6 weeks my feet were hurting, my plantar fasciitis flared up, even had to go to the doctor.  Besides following the doctors orders I ordered a new pair of 840s. My feet are back to normal. The 880 is a nice shoe other than a narrower toe box the shoe is comfortable and supportive. I will wear them on days I don’t have to do a lot of walking. If you need a wide toe box go with the 840.

This is my fourth pair of 840 running shoes.  It is only available on Amazon.  NB is not manufacturing it anymore.  They seem to have moved to a less expensive version, made of materials that wear out quickly, This version has a roomy toe-box, a reinforced strip around the entire front of the shoe, and a strong rubber sole.  Not so for the current version sold by NB. The toe-box is narrower, there is no reinforcement surrounding the front, and the sole is made of foam.  The newer version is made of materials that do not last as long as this one.
Hard to find this version, but the most comfortable for me.
Great fit.  Great shoe…I find it feels hot an heavy in the summer so I switch to my ON sneakers for the warm weather.

I have low volume, flexible feet with a low arch. Also have neuroma and a bunion and bunionette.These are the only shoes I have been able to wear without pain. They provide firm, yet flexible support with a nice round toe box so I can spread my toes. Excellent heel support. I tried the v4 last year and they were too wide and sloppy for me. I did size a half size down for the v5 and they fit perfectly. Usually in an athletic shoe I have to size up a half size but not with these. They’re great, please do not change them. I’m ordering the other color soon. Thank you, New Balance!Additional info, it is a fuller shoe but I think it can still work for those with lower volume feet. I have forefoot issues and may add a metatarsal pad to help off load my forefeet. People with foot issues have such a hard time…. I hope this helps someone else.

My favorite athletic shoe for the last five or six years. I wear them all the time and wear them out quickly so I was very pleased to see that I could get the 840 new balance on Amazon! They fit me perfectly and they are so comfortable!

I like the 940 better don't know why NB discontinued. These look good and fit about the same. Less arch support and not as much cushion at the ball of the foot which is where I have issues. Will keep them just not sure if I'll buy again or try a new brand next time. Been a NB fan for years but they just don't last like they used to, like everything else higher price lower quality.
Great sneaker. I wish New Balance had not revised the sneaker with more padding. It's not useful!

title: New Balance Women's 460 V4 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with feet not hurting at all, and appreciate their excellent quality, great fit, and nice appearance. Review.review: Love them. They fit perfectlyThey were light weight and very comfortable.  Wanted to purchase them again, but they were not available. If they become available I would gladly purchase them again

I have been a Nike girl for as long as I can remember, but the price of their shoes have increased significantly. I bought these and I was beyond impressed. I ended up getting two sizes since shoes are weird for me. I got the 9 and 9.5 in a wide size and the 9.5 was the better fit. These are comfortable for everyday use as well as running. I think I'm turning into a New Balance girly.
Great shoe.  Lite and comfortable.  You hardly even notice you have them on.
Why did you pick this product vs others?:I like the fit of New Balance shoes.

I have owned several pairs of New Balance shoes, these run a little smaller and more narrow than what I've previously purchased.  The weight and support are fine once you get them adjusted to your foot.  The quality, durability, and style are awesome.  I'll order larger than normal next time.

EDITED: Less than three months of use and the soles are worn down so the tread is almost nonexistent. I’ve never had a pair of shoes wear this much this fast. Will never buy NB again.Surprised at how little cushion is in this shoe. It’s light so good for running but not the most comfortable due to the cheap construction. Wearable, but surprisingly cheap. I imagine they won’t last long, but that’s speculation.
Well made and good for my feet but so ugly

Review.review: I'm happy because these sneakers are very comfortable, I liked them a lot.

I have a wide foot, hammer toes, bunions, and bunionettes. I have the feet of a star ballerina and the body of her single uncle joe. Regardless,  I always know a 9 wide will fit me in NB. I have tried everything out there and these are for me. But if it doesn't, returns with or without a new order are handled easily.
Does not seem to have as resilient a sole as I had expected of New Balance.Otherwise,  shoes are fine and true to size.
My New Balance running shoes fit well, support my feet, very comfortable.
Comfortable, breathable and durable. I wore these pre-pregnancy, pregnancy and post partum. Even when my feet were swollen, I still wore them just didn't tie the laces and I was good to go.
These are my go-to brand and style. Fit perfectly right out of the box with no breaking in needed. My feet are very wide and medium width is perfect.

I always wear NB to walk never have had a problem . I am 79 years old after three weeks of wearing them every day  walking the left heel leans inward . My other new balance new and old ones do not . This pair is not made correct . It is upsetting to spend this kind of $$$ and not be able to use them.
The shoe is excellent except it was a bit large for me. Packaging and delivery were great!

Review.review: These are by far the most comfortable shoes that I own. I'm on my feet all day at work & since wearing these my feet never hurt at the end of the day. Great support & looks great. Decent heel height.
Beautiful, comfortable shoes that were too small. Go a size up. Great for narrow feet
Shoes didn’t fit well, were not comfortable, offered minimal support and cheap quality.

Love the fresh foam products. Very picky about shoes bc of pain but these are comfortable and lightweight. Easy to walk or stand in for a long time but this particular also looks nice with a nicer outfit or for exercise.

Overall these are comfortable and stylish for work, running errands or going on walks.  I don’t think they’re ergonomic enough for regular running.  Also they run exceptionally small.  I’m typically a 9.5/10D (but can often wear normal width) and these shoes were quite tight when I first purchased in a 10.5D.  As long as I wear thin socks they are comfortable now but I don’t like the sizing guessing game.

Item is exactly as appears quality wise they look very well made. I wear women’s 7.5 and size was precise. However every time you try to take the shoes off the inserts slide out. And there’s nothing under them so you can’t just leave them out. They are very hard and scratchy on the ankles. So in the end they are great for appearance but not every day wear.

I love these. They are stylish, light-feeling, and easy to slip on and off (even while tied) after wearing a few times. I do not recommend them for long distance running, but I didn’t buy them for that reason so I am very happy. I wear them for bike rides but also to go out. Very versatile for my lifestyle (but I also never dress up and pretty much live in leggings so there’s that).

I work in healthcare so I’m on my feet all day and these shoes feel like walking on clouds. This is the 3rd pair I’ve gotten. I have a high arch and these are so supportive which helps with foot/knee pain. Only downside for me is the fabric around the toe area wears down fast but it could be the amount of wear put on them daily. Still love em tho!

title: New Balance Unisex-Child Dynasoft 578 V1 Lace-up Running Shoe

Fits great

Wore these all day at the fair- lots of walking and my feet and legs didn’t feel tired!
So cute on my baby feet just like the picture
A mi hija le encantaron!! Súper cómodos para el colegio
They fit okay.

Purchased these shoes for my daughter who liked the look of the shoes.  She tried them on walks around the house for a bit.  They seem okay to her.  Later that evening we go for a walk.  We didn't make it one city block and she says 'These shoes aren't made for walking.  They aren't a cushy as my old pair.'  I guess you get what you pay for.

title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X 1540 V4 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers have mixed opinions about these running shoes, with some finding them comfortable and stable, while others report issues with the toe box being too small. The cushioning receives criticism for being very squishy, and customers express concerns about durability and material quality, describing them as made of paper-like materials.

Review.review: Love the shoes , feel great .

These were a huge disappointment and I returned them. They fit completely different than the v3 and have a very soft feel. They also look cheaply made and the upper does not have any of the structure the v3 had. They did not work with my orthotics that I have used with previous versions of this shoe. I ended up switching to the 990s.

The below review shoe I was writing about was the 1540V3 a (non Fresh Foam shoe) It got placed under this 1540 v4. My review is not for the 1540v4 fresh foam. That shoe didn't fit me.These shoe lasted me almost 1 year walking almost every day. Was a perfect fit for my completely flat(born flat footed) wide 6E foot.Unfortunately, NB is discontinuing this model. The only alternative from NB, the 970 (I've tried all the others that only come in 4E, Fresh foam etc) causes calluses on my big toes. The toe box isn't quite wide enough for me.If you have a foot like mine, and can find this model in your size get as many as you can afford.
Comfortable,seem durable, very stable, relatively heavy.

I really tried to have an open mind about these shoes. But New Balance really dropped the ball on this “upgraded” shoe. All the features which made the version 3 so great have been replaced by sub-par inferior upgrades. The toe box is considerably smaller, the support in these shoes is terrible…these version 4 are far too soft and lack the support and firmness that I needed to feel secure in these shoes.The overall feel and materials of these shoes feels inexpensive and lacking quality, especially for a shoe that was $200.00.Very disappointed with New Balance and will not be buying anything from this brand unless they bring back the quality that I became accustomed to and expected.

Much more comfortable than the V3 for me, and easier to insert and remove my orthotics. The fit is better as well in the heel, and with my toes. I bought two pairs; one pair black and one pair gray (or whatever color they call it). The quality seems better so far, but only time will tell.

First of all, I had to return the first pair I bought because they were too small. The shoes are comfortable and give me the support I need but the upper quality is iffy. The tongue isn’t firm at all and flops around making tying your shoes more of a task.I’ve had this pair for a couple months and highly doubt I will get another pair when these wear out.

This shoe fits as advertised you will be surprised  immediately at how much taller they make you. There is close to 1and1/2 inches of padding  so far I am happy with this purchase I will say they are heavier than other fresh foams I have

title: New Balance Kid's 574 V1 Lace-Up Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers to be well-made and comfortable, particularly noting they're great for wide feet. Review.review: I purchased these for my 3 year old who is very picky with shoes and has wider feet.  He loved the colorway and loves wearing them.  This is our first pair of “wide” shoes for him as he has a wider foot (mostly wider toebox, and a narrow heel).  These don’t look wide at first glance but they definitely fit him perfectly; much more roomy than previous shoes he’s worn.  It seems the entire sneaker is wider, not just the toe box but his heels don’t slip out of the back.  They seem to have great traction.  The laces are elastic but are perfectly fit so they’re not too tight or too loose.  LOVE, will definitely buy more colors.
New Balance Fresh Foam sneakers are really comfortable, the best fitting shoes I've ever owned.

💯% Recommended product of the best quality at an affordable price, the best customer service for any questions or concerns, as shown in the photo, comfort quality at the best price really worth spending on a quality product. Thank you so much!!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Look great. Comfiest shoes by new balance

Los New Balance 574 V2 All Day son lindos y tienen un diseño atractivo, perfectos para combinar con cualquier atuendo casual. Sin embargo, en cuanto a comodidad, me decepcionaron un poco. No resultan tan cómodos para usarlos durante largos períodos de tiempo, ya que la amortiguación no es la mejor. Si buscas estilo más que comodidad, son una buena opción, pero para caminatas largas o uso prolongado, probablemente no sean la mejor elección.
These sneakers are true to size and very durable. I have bought so many pairs of my two boys  over the years.
Why did you pick this product vs others?:Very nice shoes I would buy them again for my boys. They’re so light and easy to put on.
My kids love these shoes; they have worn them almost every day to school this year so far! They said that they're comfortable and lightweight!

title: New Balance Mens Fresh Foam X Hierro V1 Mid-Cut
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and excellent for hiking, particularly noting their mid-ankle height support and incredible grip that provides good traction across different surfaces. The shoes receive positive feedback for their quality and appearance. Regarding fit, while some customers say it matches their size expectations, others mention they run very narrow. Moreover, durability experiences are mixed, with some saying they hold up well while others report issues with the sole separating.

Review.review: I’ve worn em up mountains and also walking around downtown. Comfy, stylish, and I haven’t been able to break them yet. Offers good support for the foot and keeps good traction on loose angled terrain. Size is typical for NB shoes, true to the number. Color is nice, understated. It does the job and looks good free taking a beating.

I had to get the 15 x wide for toe room and width but now the fit is great. Whether I'm walking city streets or forest trails these are comfortable, light weight and support my ankles well. They don't get too hot and don't pick up aot of little stones or dirt. Great model. I looked at lots of different possibilities.Really happy I found these.

I got double wide for this one and New Balance is one of few companies that sell double wide boots. Of course it is Gore-Tex, so you do not have to worry at all to get your feet wet. Both support and tractions are awesome. I did wear this all day several times and it is very comfortable after walking all day. Double wide width fits me nicely and it is a top notch shoe that I can recommend. Try it!

The New Balance Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid is an excellent hiking shoe—comfortable, durable, and perfect for switching between terrains, including water. The grip is solid, and the cushioning makes long hikes much more enjoyable. Whether you’re on rocky trails, muddy paths, or shallow streams, these shoes hold up really well.The only downside is the tongue can be irritating if you’re not wearing long socks. It tends to rub against the skin, which can get uncomfortable over time. But as long as you pair them with the right socks, they’re a fantastic choice for outdoor adventures.Highly recommend for hikers looking for comfort, durability, and versatility!

The price is high but I got a pair half price on Amazon due to limited sizes left in one color. The boot arrived in one day, about 4 hours before a snow storm, so I got to try them out quickly on my 5 mile walk this morning. My area plows their paths so I walked mostly on blacktop with a thin layer of snow/ice. These shoes have amazing grip on slippery surfaces and even in places where I walked through 4 inches of snow the grip was very good. The boots are fairly light weight and I love the fresh foam comfort. They fit well and are waterproof at least in snow. Perfect for my needs. I have a custom insole and it fit nicely inside. The boot with the original inserts does not have much arch support which surprised me.

I would really like a breathable, waterproof hiking shoe but these are not. They are the most water RESISTANT shoes I have purchased on Amazon & certainly worth $50 but not $120. I have goretex outer wear that is impervious to water so it is hard to understand why these were not the same. I did not even test them in rain, standing water, puddles, creeks or streams; only in 4-6 in long grass after a steady rain. Water only seeped in slightly at the toe but if more water, rain or foliage was present it would be worse. On a positive note the shoes are very comfortable. The laces require double tying - irritating. The eyelets in the shoe are not reinforced so the hole is deforming. Other lace “cleats” are a fabric that may be coming loose at the stitching. The top 2 cleats are metal & are fine. There is a “lip” at the bottom rear heal that almost looks like mold forming excess that should have been trimmed. It may serve as a toe pry point to ease remove of shoe. However it collects dirt & sometimes catches on brush. Hope this aids your decision tree.
Not much padding in the footbed. Not terrible, but if you like the feel of Altra or Hoka, you'll hate these.

True to size and is very comfortable to wear. I haven't had any issues with them. I wear them for casual wear in the winter. The Gortex liner makes them warm and dry. I am not able to hike anymore so l don't know how they are for traction, but l would assume they are good due to the lugs on the soles. I am not into style as much as l am into function and these have ankle support that l need.

title: New Balance Mens Fresh Foam X Vongo V6

The New Balance Fresh Foam X Vongo v6 excels as a daily trainer for runners seeking a harmonious blend of comfort, support, and durability. Its thoughtful design caters to those requiring mild stability, making it a versatile option for various running needs.
Fit good comfortable

My son loves these shoes. He said that the fresh foam insole is very comfortable, and the outsole is also very supportive and comfortable for long walk. It has arch support and stability control. Will buy again.
Very comfortable, but my heel slides out a bit if not tied tight. I've owned several pairs of New Balance, but these are the only ones that the heel slides out.
Comfortable and nice looking
My son loves these shoes. He has a white pair that are just nasty, but he wouldn’t stop wearing them so I had to order him another pair (but black this time).
I've purchased Vongo V6 before with great success.  A pair usually last me 5-6 months.  This pair is terrible.  After two weeks they were flat. My foot pads were sore and arches in pain.
